<subtitle id="H21DABED7243B449FB02A8C4DC5894997" qb-display-quote="yes" style="OLC"> E Defense-wide, Joint, and Multiservice Matters <section display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HC4E493FF197A4C1EB3D0F0EF35E6FD29" qb-display-quote="yes" section-type="subsequent-section"> 161. MODIFICATION TO AIR FORCE AND NAVY USE OF COMMERCIAL DUAL-USE PARTS IN CERTAIN AIRCRAFT AND ENGINES Section 161 of the National Defense Authorization Act for Fiscal Year 2023 (Public Law 117–263; 10 U.S.C. 3453 note) is amended— <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H644CA35B4CF44E4E964F090FF97A0A69" qb-display-quote="yes"> (1) in the section heading, by striking <quote quote-display-end="auto" quote-display-start="auto" quote-type="text"> used ; <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H3BD4202755814168BD0C443927613C99" qb-display-quote="yes"> (2) in subsection (a)(1), by inserting <quote quote-display-end="auto" quote-display-start="auto" quote-type="text">new, before <quote quote-display-end="auto" quote-display-start="auto" quote-type="text">used; and <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H980EBF994407452295D4D3A336863A40" qb-display-quote="yes"> (3) in subsection (b)(2), by inserting <quote quote-display-end="auto" quote-display-start="auto" quote-type="text">, or from a certified production approval holder pursuant to part 21 of title 14, Code of Federal Regulations before the period at the end.

<subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H35D638A590FC496FB6FB65FECAD7B3FD" qb-display-quote="yes"> (b) Elements The measures carried out under subsection (a) shall include the following: <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HC60FF691EDEB45BEB46779816D891FAB" qb-display-quote="yes"> (1) Disassembly and analysis of commercially available foreign drone aircraft Not later than 90 days after the date of the enactment of this Act and not less frequently than once every three years thereafter until 2034, the Secretary of Defense shall fully disassemble a drone aircraft made by Da Jiang Innovations or a similar commercially available sUAS manufactured in a covered foreign country in order to— <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HAA286A5E3AF744758AEB1B47DAD41896" qb-display-quote="yes"> (A) create a taxonomy for each component that categorizes the component by function, level of risk, and such other criteria as the Secretary determines appropriate; and <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HAC8F5F35FFF34DAD891AF55EB984FE78" qb-display-quote="yes"> (B) help assess the risk of such components for the purposes of supply chain monitoring and visibility. <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HC17C49D17BEC42A2B1813E72092AF234" qb-display-quote="yes"> (2) Supply chain risk framework Not later than 150 days after the date of the enactment of this Act and using the taxonomy developed under paragraph (1)(A), the Secretary of Defense shall develop a supply chain risk framework in order to— <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H37302651966E4275A95BFA435F34A762" qb-display-quote="yes"> (A) assess the risk of each sUAS component to Department of Defense networks or operations; <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H94DFD2073FC849588C6222BD2100D2B8" qb-display-quote="yes"> (B) for components that present a risk as determined under subparagraph (A), identify any manufacturers of such components are based in covered foreign countries and evaluate whether measures to mitigate the risk posed by such foreign-produced components are feasible or practical; and <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HB9158B7C3D4B4BFC9DC9786F47D14623" qb-display-quote="yes"> (C) determine if any of the foreign companies in the sUAS supply chain should be included on the list maintained by the Department of Defense in accordance with section 1260H of the National Defense Authorization Act for Fiscal Year 2021 (Public Law 116–283; 10 U.S.C. 113 note).

<subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H944C571A5D1F40509BF3E8D727A1DC4D" qb-display-quote="yes"> (d) Form The report required under subsection (c) shall be submitted in unclassified form, but may include a classified annex. <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HB09622DB2C384B98BF43A5DA78670303" qb-display-quote="yes"> (e) Covered foreign country defined In this section, the term <quote quote-display-end="auto" quote-display-start="auto" quote-type="text">covered foreign country has the meaning given that term in section 848(e) of the National Defense Authorization Act for Fiscal Year 2020 (Public Law 116–92; 10 U.S.C. 4871 note).

<paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H774826C151EE4484AA2895E9D01C86DA" qb-display-quote="yes"> (2) The term <quote quote-display-end="auto" quote-display-start="auto" quote-type="text">covered LiDAR company means any of the following: <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HB1D58AE5318543BE8ABA57D83CB5B5A0" qb-display-quote="yes"> (A) Hesai Technology (or any subsidiary or affiliate of Hesai Technology). <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HFE98EC00D3F14B7387D8DAF9B12BA94A" qb-display-quote="yes"> (B) Any entity that produces or provides LiDAR and that is included on— <clause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H274CAEBD60A44862BFE39DD85121EF77" qb-display-quote="yes"> (i) the Consolidated Screening List maintained by the International Trade Administration of the Department of Commerce; or <clause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HE8E85704BE064602AAC28EA9CEB764D8" qb-display-quote="yes"> (ii) the civil-military fusion list maintained under section 1260h of the William M. (Mac) Thornberry National Defense Authorization Act for Fiscal Year 2021 (Public Law 116–283; 10 U.S.C. 113 note).

<subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HFE7CB156C79043158853FFC59082ECA7" qb-display-quote="yes"> (b) Implementation plan Not later than 120 days after the date of the enactment of this Act, the Secretary of the Air Force shall develop and initiate an implementation plan for the transfers required under subsection (a). <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HB95E7F79447F4C1E90E3291203A8EF58" qb-display-quote="yes"> (c) Report Not later than 30 days after completing the development of the implementation plan required under subsection (b), the Secretary of the Air Force shall submit to the Committees on Armed Services of the House of Representatives and the Senate a report that includes a description of— <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H959CEBD49555439CB088F8884A0DCD2F" qb-display-quote="yes"> (1) the planned milestones for execution of the implementation plan; <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H68B3F39535FE4636B604776DA6DAF1AB" qb-display-quote="yes"> (2) any data, staff, and funding needed to effectively carry out such plan; and <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H45FB5CBDA9BE41DAA5C376F750956DC8" qb-display-quote="yes"> (3) the progress of the Secretary in meeting such milestones as of the date of the report. <section display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H951539F4237F453199DA5A122DF566FC" qb-display-quote="yes" section-type="subsequent-section"> 148.

<subtitle id="H0D6EB03E02F74557BC873FDE9F2CB1B2" qb-display-quote="yes" style="OLC"> A Authorization of Appropriations <section display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HF198EA31D7DA48B39EC4D96ED8512711" qb-display-quote="yes" section-type="subsequent-section"> 101. AUTHORIZATION OF APPROPRIATIONS Funds are hereby authorized to be appropriated for fiscal year 2025 for procurement for the Army, the Navy and the Marine Corps, the Air Force and the Space Force, and Defense-wide activities, as specified in the funding table in section 4101. <subtitle id="H025B6ACD7BA64CB7BC670C3EA7C7BDDA" qb-display-quote="yes" style="OLC"> B Army Programs <section display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HF5748EC195C84CC9ABA4B3751FEC2B3F" qb-display-quote="yes" section-type="subsequent-section"> 111.

<paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H7AFFACCBB3254083B530698595567D17" qb-display-quote="yes"> (2) Locations Identification of at least three military installations selected to host the Program. These locations shall— <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H16A2440EEB6B49998CB7E93C7E2160C6" qb-display-quote="yes"> (A) serve as the primary hubs for the continuous monitoring of installation security across all installations of the Department of the Army in the United States; <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H4E26FAB0C5FA408A9ED3CB2B31B28452" qb-display-quote="yes"> (B) represent a mix of large and extra-large facilities, as defined by the 2016 business case analysis conducted by the Provost Marshal General of the Army; and <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HAF80BFC23FE6463D9D031A3CD38530A4" qb-display-quote="yes"> (C) be chosen based on geographical diversity and their strategic importance to the Army’s overall security infrastructure. <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H405DEDE0D90F442CA9963846F464A218" qb-display-quote="yes"> (3) Cost A comprehensive breakdown of the full costs of the Program, including— <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HDD9871D21E804E1AAC2851E9EEC06670" qb-display-quote="yes"> (A) initial capital expenditure for system implementation; <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HC14A65C43067400D84CDAE99014255F4" qb-display-quote="yes"> (B) the cost of networking all installations and facilities across the Department of the Army within the United States; <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HDF17CCF2C44F4BF2AD39795B9DFA5F8B" qb-display-quote="yes"> (C) estimated operation and maintenance costs; <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H30ECE32CD2A24C31A0306579E9D71434" qb-display-quote="yes"> (D) a detailed funding schedule with expenditures projected across the period covered by the most recent future-years defense program submitted to Congress under section 221 of title 10, United States Code (as of the date of the plan); and <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H535267D15CF044BD87210DE59534BC71" qb-display-quote="yes"> (E) identification of potential cost-saving opportunities from the consolidation of current security monitoring systems.

<section display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H205B9A22A7ED4C4D99680BA90FFFDA3F" qb-display-quote="yes" section-type="subsequent-section"> 130. LIMITATION ON STRUCTURAL IMPROVEMENTS AND ELECTRICAL POWER UPGRADES FOR AH–1Z AND UH–1Y HELICOPTERS <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H61113AF53E9748CD9A720B1F3FB81E3F" qb-display-quote="yes"> (a) Limitation The Secretary of the Navy may not carry out covered upgrades to AH–1Z Viper and UH–1Y Venom helicopters at a location other than a facility owned by the original equipment manufacturer for such helicopters until the date on which the Secretary certifies to the Committees on Armed Services of the Senate and the House of Representatives that the plan for carrying out covered upgrades at location other than a facility owned by the original equipment manufacturer is expected— <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H0ACF379DCAF64500AA2F2419DCB7459B" qb-display-quote="yes"> (1) to result in levels of performance, survivability, lethality, interoperability, mission execution, and overall safety of the helicopter platform that match or exceed the levels that would otherwise be achievable by completing such upgrades at a facility owned by the original equipment manufacturer for the model of helicopter involved; <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H379594F86E0148E2BB9D65A56A8E20A7" qb-display-quote="yes"> (2) to provide improved onboard electrical power capacity and ensure adequate power margin for integrating future capabilities; <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H06661D0A10C44EB6A4AE7F35295780F3" qb-display-quote="yes"> (3) to improve and expand future weapons interfaces; and <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HBB50403A03CA4B28BD0CFC6C6EA55F46" qb-display-quote="yes"> (4) to allow for improved ease of maintenance. <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H39369D8C706347A3B38EB7626F4D2527" qb-display-quote="yes"> (b) Covered upgrades In this section, the term <quote quote-display-end="auto" quote-display-start="auto" quote-type="text">covered upgrades means any structural improvements or electrical power upgrades for AH–1Z Viper or UH–1Y Venom helicopters.

LIMITATION ON STRUCTURAL IMPROVEMENTS AND ELECTRICAL POWER UPGRADES FOR AH–1Z AND UH–1Y HELICOPTERS <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H61113AF53E9748CD9A720B1F3FB81E3F" qb-display-quote="yes"> (a) Limitation The Secretary of the Navy may not carry out covered upgrades to AH–1Z Viper and UH–1Y Venom helicopters at a location other than a facility owned by the original equipment manufacturer for such helicopters until the date on which the Secretary certifies to the Committees on Armed Services of the Senate and the House of Representatives that the plan for carrying out covered upgrades at location other than a facility owned by the original equipment manufacturer is expected— <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H0ACF379DCAF64500AA2F2419DCB7459B" qb-display-quote="yes"> (1) to result in levels of performance, survivability, lethality, interoperability, mission execution, and overall safety of the helicopter platform that match or exceed the levels that would otherwise be achievable by completing such upgrades at a facility owned by the original equipment manufacturer for the model of helicopter involved; <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H379594F86E0148E2BB9D65A56A8E20A7" qb-display-quote="yes"> (2) to provide improved onboard electrical power capacity and ensure adequate power margin for integrating future capabilities; <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H06661D0A10C44EB6A4AE7F35295780F3" qb-display-quote="yes"> (3) to improve and expand future weapons interfaces; and <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HBB50403A03CA4B28BD0CFC6C6EA55F46" qb-display-quote="yes"> (4) to allow for improved ease of maintenance. <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H39369D8C706347A3B38EB7626F4D2527" qb-display-quote="yes"> (b) Covered upgrades In this section, the term <quote quote-display-end="auto" quote-display-start="auto" quote-type="text">covered upgrades means any structural improvements or electrical power upgrades for AH–1Z Viper or UH–1Y Venom helicopters. <section display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H50E504EBB56B4D6AB32195C3D6CBAC35" qb-display-quote="yes" section-type="subsequent-section"> 131.

LIMITATION ON STRUCTURAL IMPROVEMENTS AND ELECTRICAL POWER UPGRADES FOR AH–1Z AND UH–1Y HELICOPTERS <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H61113AF53E9748CD9A720B1F3FB81E3F" qb-display-quote="yes"> (a) Limitation The Secretary of the Navy may not carry out covered upgrades to AH–1Z Viper and UH–1Y Venom helicopters at a location other than a facility owned by the original equipment manufacturer for such helicopters until the date on which the Secretary certifies to the Committees on Armed Services of the Senate and the House of Representatives that the plan for carrying out covered upgrades at location other than a facility owned by the original equipment manufacturer is expected— <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H0ACF379DCAF64500AA2F2419DCB7459B" qb-display-quote="yes"> (1) to result in levels of performance, survivability, lethality, interoperability, mission execution, and overall safety of the helicopter platform that match or exceed the levels that would otherwise be achievable by completing such upgrades at a facility owned by the original equipment manufacturer for the model of helicopter involved; <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H379594F86E0148E2BB9D65A56A8E20A7" qb-display-quote="yes"> (2) to provide improved onboard electrical power capacity and ensure adequate power margin for integrating future capabilities; <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H06661D0A10C44EB6A4AE7F35295780F3" qb-display-quote="yes"> (3) to improve and expand future weapons interfaces; and <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HBB50403A03CA4B28BD0CFC6C6EA55F46" qb-display-quote="yes"> (4) to allow for improved ease of maintenance. <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H39369D8C706347A3B38EB7626F4D2527" qb-display-quote="yes"> (b) Covered upgrades In this section, the term <quote quote-display-end="auto" quote-display-start="auto" quote-type="text">covered upgrades means any structural improvements or electrical power upgrades for AH–1Z Viper or UH–1Y Venom helicopters. <section display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H50E504EBB56B4D6AB32195C3D6CBAC35" qb-display-quote="yes" section-type="subsequent-section"> 131.

<section display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H50E504EBB56B4D6AB32195C3D6CBAC35" qb-display-quote="yes" section-type="subsequent-section"> 131. ANNUAL REPORT ON SURFACE SHIP SUPPLIERS <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HF748861A598D4E99B52D3F8B9FA803A7" qb-display-quote="yes"> (a) In general Not later than 180 days after the date of the enactment of this Act, and once every fiscal year thereafter through September 30, 2029, the Secretary of the Navy shall submit to the congressional defense committees a report analyzing suppliers of components for surface ships of the Navy. <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H23DF4BB118D14444B3D54C3E9CAE4B5B" qb-display-quote="yes"> (b) Elements Each report required by subsection (a) shall include the following: <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H203C4BFB9CBE4C70A8CE606D4CC1AC35" qb-display-quote="yes"> (1) An assessment of the status of each supplier of surface ship components using the same or a similar methodology to that used in the Navy’s evaluation tool for suppliers of components for Columbia-class submarines.

<paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H4245846AA48F4E618C9C7145B2334540" qb-display-quote="yes"> (5) Any plans of the Secretary to augment or supplant existing piloted tactical fighter aircraft training events through the acquisition and fielding of common, joint, all-domain, high-fidelity synthetic simulation environments. <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H3C839943E2BA4F50B324E7845DF793E3" qb-display-quote="yes"> (c) Form of report The report required by subsection (a) shall be submitted in unclassified form with accompanying graphs, tables, and charts, but may contain a classified annex. <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H7181931D9ECC4D0BA205E4536FA41672" qb-display-quote="yes"> (d) Fighter aircraft defined In this section, the term <quote quote-display-end="auto" quote-display-start="auto" quote-type="text">fighter aircraft has the meaning given that term in section 9062(i)(2) of this title.

MODIFICATIONS TO INVENTORY REQUIREMENTS FOR CERTAIN AIRCRAFT <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H008727A9649E4EC8969678462D0D8A7C" qb-display-quote="yes"> (a) Temporary exception to minimum primary mission aircraft inventory Section 133 of the National Defense Authorization Act for Fiscal Year 2024 (Public Law 118–31; 137 Stat. 173) is amended— <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H60D974A2411D4A9E8837C83EF030CB4B" qb-display-quote="yes"> (1) in subsection (a), by striking <quote quote-display-end="auto" quote-display-start="auto" quote-type="text">1,112 aircraft and inserting <quote quote-display-end="auto" quote-display-start="auto" quote-type="text">1,101 aircraft; and <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H6EABF3EB18044AEEB6B66CEC0091B094" qb-display-quote="yes"> (2) in subsection (c)(1), by striking <quote quote-display-end="auto" quote-display-start="auto" quote-type="text">2024 and inserting <quote quote-display-end="auto" quote-display-start="auto" quote-type="text">2025. <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H1C57551215C049B49E391CE7DDECB591" qb-display-quote="yes"> (b) A-10 aircraft minimum inventory requirement Section 134(d) of the National Defense Authorization Act for Fiscal Year 2017 (Public Law 114–328; 130 Stat.

1574), as most recently amended by section 136 of the National Defense Authorization Act for Fiscal Year 2024 (Public Law 118–31; 137 Stat. 174), is further amended— <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H18B0AF9BA83C43ED90AC4239139755F1" qb-display-quote="yes"> (1) by redesignating subsection (c) as subsection (d); and <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H3A1C588D7CFB41C09691008E33425B17" qb-display-quote="yes"> (2) by inserting after subsection (b) the following new subsection (c): <quoted-block display-end-quotes="yes" display-inline="no-display-inline" display-quotes="yes" id="H8D51C1FBC1C448F090297E2E696308A5" style="OLC"> <section display-inline="no-display-inline" id="d1e4701" qb-display-quote="yes" section-type="subsequent-section"> <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HE79EA103A66A4A8582FD59D896E3703E" qb-display-quote="yes"> (c) Temporary relocation The Secretary of the Air Force shall, to the extent practicable, manage the temporary relocation of any B–1 bomber aircraft or personnel assigned to units responsible for the operation and maintenance of such aircraft resulting from planned military construction in a manner that— <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H4BABF110BD1B49CA85CD413A48612956" qb-display-quote="yes"> (1) minimizes effects to combat readiness; <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HE4E0A434E26046089F7E29244D6E161E" qb-display-quote="yes"> (2) mitigates the risk of concentrating a significant number of the total B–1 bomber fleet at one location; <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H2573DF7EBBCD49DBB10BAE05F38CBED7" qb-display-quote="yes"> (3) uses the construction period to maximize expeditionary actions such as through Bomber Task Force and Agile Combat Employment; and <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HD542DCF5CC434236A0AB0064D7130A4C" qb-display-quote="yes"> (4) takes into consideration travel options and travel distance for families and dependents of such personnel. .

1574), as most recently amended by section 136 of the National Defense Authorization Act for Fiscal Year 2024 (Public Law 118–31; 137 Stat. 174), is further amended— <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H18B0AF9BA83C43ED90AC4239139755F1" qb-display-quote="yes"> (1) by redesignating subsection (c) as subsection (d); and <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H3A1C588D7CFB41C09691008E33425B17" qb-display-quote="yes"> (2) by inserting after subsection (b) the following new subsection (c): <quoted-block display-end-quotes="yes" display-inline="no-display-inline" display-quotes="yes" id="H8D51C1FBC1C448F090297E2E696308A5" style="OLC"> <section display-inline="no-display-inline" id="d1e4701" qb-display-quote="yes" section-type="subsequent-section"> <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HE79EA103A66A4A8582FD59D896E3703E" qb-display-quote="yes"> (c) Temporary relocation The Secretary of the Air Force shall, to the extent practicable, manage the temporary relocation of any B–1 bomber aircraft or personnel assigned to units responsible for the operation and maintenance of such aircraft resulting from planned military construction in a manner that— <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H4BABF110BD1B49CA85CD413A48612956" qb-display-quote="yes"> (1) minimizes effects to combat readiness; <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HE4E0A434E26046089F7E29244D6E161E" qb-display-quote="yes"> (2) mitigates the risk of concentrating a significant number of the total B–1 bomber fleet at one location; <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H2573DF7EBBCD49DBB10BAE05F38CBED7" qb-display-quote="yes"> (3) uses the construction period to maximize expeditionary actions such as through Bomber Task Force and Agile Combat Employment; and <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HD542DCF5CC434236A0AB0064D7130A4C" qb-display-quote="yes"> (4) takes into consideration travel options and travel distance for families and dependents of such personnel. .

<section display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H0216E45DE8984279B89D46ED81D4852A" qb-display-quote="yes" section-type="subsequent-section"> 147. CONSOLIDATION OF AUTHORITIES RELATING TO AIR FORCE LANDING GEAR <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H1671B1ACF20340EA91B7F58CBA33895B" qb-display-quote="yes"> (a) In general The Secretary of the Air Force shall transfer to the Air Force Sustainment Center supply chain management, item management, and delegated engineering authorities for landing gear systems of F–15EX, F–22, F–35, and T–7A aircraft. <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HFE7CB156C79043158853FFC59082ECA7" qb-display-quote="yes"> (b) Implementation plan Not later than 120 days after the date of the enactment of this Act, the Secretary of the Air Force shall develop and initiate an implementation plan for the transfers required under subsection (a).

<paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HE9A0A61C222745B4AEE50B668ADEEC2C" qb-display-quote="yes"> (3) Relationship to other law The prohibition under paragraph (1) supercedes any provision of section 9062(l) of title 10, United States Code, that is inconsistent with such prohibition. <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HDCC653A1BB94419FA93CEA6D09EFF786" qb-display-quote="yes"> (b) Fighter aircraft capabilities and requirements study <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H097D63A2404C47D1A0550DE16DDE8B11" qb-display-quote="yes"> (1) Study The Secretary of Defense shall seek to enter into a contract or other agreement with a federally funded research and development center pursuant to which the center shall carry out— <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H8940A8C963B2466EBDB8E8BDC5099D06" qb-display-quote="yes"> (A) an analysis of the fighter aircraft procurement, fielding, and divestment plan of the Department of the Air Force, as submitted to Congress in accordance with section 148 of the National Defense Authorization Act for Fiscal Year 2024 (Public Law 118–31; 137 Stat. 178); and <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H66AA9F3D29B64051AF08DD58B3C4B2E2" qb-display-quote="yes"> (B) a fighter aircraft capability and requirements study that estimates the number of fighter aircraft needed by the Air Force to meet the requirements of combatant commanders.

BUDGETARY EFFECTS OF THIS ACT The budgetary effects of this Act, for the purposes of complying with the Statutory Pay-As-You-Go Act of 2010, shall be determined by reference to the latest statement titled <quote quote-display-end="auto" quote-display-start="auto" quote-type="text">Budgetary Effects of PAYGO Legislation for this Act, jointly submitted for printing in the Congressional Record by the Chairmen of the House and Senate Budget Committees, provided that such statement has been submitted prior to the vote on passage in the House acting first on the conference report or amendment between the Houses. <section display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H67A4D6B105A9414E850ABC008AF68534" qb-display-quote="yes" section-type="subsequent-section"> 5.

JOINT EXPLANATORY STATEMENT The joint explanatory statement regarding this Act, printed in the House section of the Congressional Record on or about December 11, 2024, by the Chairman of the Committee on Armed Services of the House of Representatives and the Chairman of the Committee on Armed Services of the Senate, shall have the same effect with respect to the implementation of this Act as if it were a joint explanatory statement of a committee of conference. <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H75420C0FFC3D4A99ACF34FB032B801FF" qb-display-quote="yes"> (e) Selection of participating units The Secretary of the Army shall select infantry units of the reserve components of the Army to participate in the pilot program under subsection (a) taking into consideration— <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H12B8836C3FC144FD9F3FEA39DDE2DF6F" qb-display-quote="yes"> (1) the past performance of the unit; <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H5116B9F4334047F0A0C8888B6BED8DFE" qb-display-quote="yes"> (2) the readiness status of the unit, with an emphasis on providing training to those units designated as preparing to deploy or at a similarly designated readiness status; and <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H3ED5E8E858D14217AF97041B47C98944" qb-display-quote="yes"> (3) the likelihood that a unit would be actively deployed or commanded to conduct decisive action. <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H97D0E2B3DC444353852EC41883AF3C9D" qb-display-quote="yes"> (f) Commencement The Secretary of the Army shall commence the pilot program under subsection (a) not later than 180 days after the date of the enactment of this Act. <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H9956A941E914466184A5756432265D82" qb-display-quote="yes"> (g) Termination The pilot program under subsection (a) shall terminate five years after the date of the enactment of this Act.

<subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H97D0E2B3DC444353852EC41883AF3C9D" qb-display-quote="yes"> (f) Commencement The Secretary of the Army shall commence the pilot program under subsection (a) not later than 180 days after the date of the enactment of this Act. <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H9956A941E914466184A5756432265D82" qb-display-quote="yes"> (g) Termination The pilot program under subsection (a) shall terminate five years after the date of the enactment of this Act. <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H94FE8A19C35A4F18A241AF04DC641D0C" qb-display-quote="yes"> (h) Briefings Not later than 90 days after concluding activities under the pilot program at a military installation selected under subsection (c), the Secretary of the Army shall provide to the Committees on Armed Services of the Senate and the House of Representatives a briefing that includes a description of— <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H756B7D936EC447D0B2F5FB14306E019A" qb-display-quote="yes"> (1) the manner in which the program was conducted at such installation; and <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H057BC9B38F1C41D8909199C02CCE76A0" qb-display-quote="yes"> (2) any results achieved under the program at such installation.

<subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H97D0E2B3DC444353852EC41883AF3C9D" qb-display-quote="yes"> (f) Commencement The Secretary of the Army shall commence the pilot program under subsection (a) not later than 180 days after the date of the enactment of this Act. <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H9956A941E914466184A5756432265D82" qb-display-quote="yes"> (g) Termination The pilot program under subsection (a) shall terminate five years after the date of the enactment of this Act. <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H94FE8A19C35A4F18A241AF04DC641D0C" qb-display-quote="yes"> (h) Briefings Not later than 90 days after concluding activities under the pilot program at a military installation selected under subsection (c), the Secretary of the Army shall provide to the Committees on Armed Services of the Senate and the House of Representatives a briefing that includes a description of— <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H756B7D936EC447D0B2F5FB14306E019A" qb-display-quote="yes"> (1) the manner in which the program was conducted at such installation; and <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H057BC9B38F1C41D8909199C02CCE76A0" qb-display-quote="yes"> (2) any results achieved under the program at such installation.

<subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H9956A941E914466184A5756432265D82" qb-display-quote="yes"> (g) Termination The pilot program under subsection (a) shall terminate five years after the date of the enactment of this Act. <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H94FE8A19C35A4F18A241AF04DC641D0C" qb-display-quote="yes"> (h) Briefings Not later than 90 days after concluding activities under the pilot program at a military installation selected under subsection (c), the Secretary of the Army shall provide to the Committees on Armed Services of the Senate and the House of Representatives a briefing that includes a description of— <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H756B7D936EC447D0B2F5FB14306E019A" qb-display-quote="yes"> (1) the manner in which the program was conducted at such installation; and <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H057BC9B38F1C41D8909199C02CCE76A0" qb-display-quote="yes"> (2) any results achieved under the program at such installation. <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H535991AFAF114B38B8F987DBC4FB1D7F" qb-display-quote="yes"> (i) Contract authority <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H24B1C21CC3C645D88129FFEBA27189B8" qb-display-quote="yes"> (1) In general The Secretary of the Army is authorized to enter into one or more contracts for the procurement of moving robotic target systems for use in the pilot program under subsection (a).

ANNUAL REPORT ON AIR FORCE TACTICAL FIGHTER AIRCRAFT FORCE STRUCTURE. <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HD930DBE5A09D44EC9CABA44455C70660" qb-display-quote="yes"> (a) In general Not later than April 1, 2025, and annually thereafter through 2029, the Secretary of the Air Force, in consultation with the Director of the Air National Guard and the Commander of the Air Force Reserve Command, shall— <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H348BD966754C4EA2A83C1F3F40027CDD" qb-display-quote="yes"> (1) develop a 10-year tactical fighter aircraft force structure, recapitalization, training, and sustainment plan for the active and reserve components of the Air Force; and <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HA7F8D270018747A0B928519F98E92FE9" qb-display-quote="yes"> (2) submit to the congressional defense committees a report on the plan. <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H04503E01254F4E5C813B2A002514EE8A" qb-display-quote="yes"> (b) Elements of report The report required by subsection (a) shall address each of the following: <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H015AB43C7643444880E1A9316C019C95" qb-display-quote="yes"> (1) The appropriate mix of tactical fighter aircraft, and associated operational risk analyses, required for the Secretary of the Air Force to meet expected steady-state, global force management allocation plans and geographic combatant commander contingency operational plans tasked to the Air Force, using active and reserve component tactical fighter aircraft units.

and <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H3A1C588D7CFB41C09691008E33425B17" qb-display-quote="yes"> (2) by inserting after subsection (b) the following new subsection (c): <quoted-block display-end-quotes="yes" display-inline="no-display-inline" display-quotes="yes" id="H8D51C1FBC1C448F090297E2E696308A5" style="OLC"> <section display-inline="no-display-inline" id="d1e4701" qb-display-quote="yes" section-type="subsequent-section"> <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HE79EA103A66A4A8582FD59D896E3703E" qb-display-quote="yes"> (c) Temporary relocation The Secretary of the Air Force shall, to the extent practicable, manage the temporary relocation of any B–1 bomber aircraft or personnel assigned to units responsible for the operation and maintenance of such aircraft resulting from planned military construction in a manner that— <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H4BABF110BD1B49CA85CD413A48612956" qb-display-quote="yes"> (1) minimizes effects to combat readiness; <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HE4E0A434E26046089F7E29244D6E161E" qb-display-quote="yes"> (2) mitigates the risk of concentrating a significant number of the total B–1 bomber fleet at one location; <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H2573DF7EBBCD49DBB10BAE05F38CBED7" qb-display-quote="yes"> (3) uses the construction period to maximize expeditionary actions such as through Bomber Task Force and Agile Combat Employment; and <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HD542DCF5CC434236A0AB0064D7130A4C" qb-display-quote="yes"> (4) takes into consideration travel options and travel distance for families and dependents of such personnel. .

PLAN FOR SUSTAINMENT AND RECAPITALIZATION OF AIR NATIONAL GUARD FIGHTER FLEET <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HEF1A775C3F644537B87D9E411C77DCA6" qb-display-quote="yes"> (a) In general The Secretary of the Air Force, in consultation with the Director of the Air National Guard, shall develop a plan to sustain and recapitalize the fighter fleet of the Air National Guard. <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HD5440D431C7B499D9652A3F510570257" qb-display-quote="yes"> (b) Elements The recapitalization plan required under subsection (a) shall— <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H1A45BFCA30954E8293C9BBA308A4879F" qb-display-quote="yes"> (1) identify each of the 25 fighter aircraft squadrons of the Air National Guard in existence on the date of the enactment of this Act; <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H6C177133542F434E937F67EB938537A4" qb-display-quote="yes"> (2) provide a plan for recapitalization of all such squadrons at a similar rate as the fighter aircraft squadrons of the active components of the Armed Forces, with the same combination of legacy capability fighter aircraft and advanced capability fighter aircraft found in fighter aircraft squadrons of the active components of the Armed Forces; <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H3BE19FD1DDD241A3A7102EF4EA15AA61" qb-display-quote="yes"> (3) establish a timetable for a plan or actions for the recapitalization proposed under paragraph (2), disaggregated by fighter aircraft squadron and fiscal year, which shall identify funding required for each fiscal year; <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H1ABB7655DBAF4905915533C4C7AFBA60" qb-display-quote="yes"> (4) assess budgetary effects on the active components of the Armed Forces if the recapitalization plan proposed under paragraph (2) were implemented in accordance with the timeline established in paragraph (3); and <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H7A1C045C10864B0381989C7A7A32F04D" qb-display-quote="yes"> (5) assess the effects of such plan on the operational readiness and personnel readiness of the active and reserve components of the Armed Forces, including the effects of such plan on the ability of such components to meet steady state and contingency force presentation and mission requirements of combatant commanders. <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H51DC424233AC4026B5B1139FBF3643C7" qb-display-quote="yes"> (c) Report <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H140F6D22495844CFAA30845AA699D3F4" qb-display-quote="yes"> (1) In general Not later than July 1, 2025, the Secretary of the Air Force shall submit to the congressional defense committees a report that includes the sustainment and recapitalization plan required under subsection (a).

<subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H5640D974C9F2469C80A4C1E6E9E454B7" qb-display-quote="yes"> (d) Definitions In this section: <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HFF14D63CC2A04E248CDCD16903045DFE" qb-display-quote="yes"> (1) The term <quote quote-display-end="auto" quote-display-start="auto" quote-type="text">advanced capability fighter aircraft— <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HDCE95573E3E541E6BE1333E0A7F2837E" qb-display-quote="yes"> (A) means the next-generation air dominance fighter aircraft or any other fighter aircraft referenced or designated as a sixth generation airframe; and <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H8D03768CD75E4D5DA014DB8EE83B37AD" qb-display-quote="yes"> (B) does not include unmanned fighter aircraft. <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HC81AF051E2CD4B6B93ACBD4EC0D3C351" qb-display-quote="yes"> (2) The term <quote quote-display-end="auto" quote-display-start="auto" quote-type="text">fifth generation, with respect to fighter aircraft, means an F–22 or F–35 aircraft. <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HC34D397B7D5A4C5AAAC995183E9ED3F3" qb-display-quote="yes"> (3) The term <quote quote-display-end="auto" quote-display-start="auto" quote-type="text">fighter aircraft has the meaning given that term in section 9062(i)(2) of title 10, United States Code.

MEASURES TO INCREASE SUPPLY CHAIN RESILIENCY FOR SMALL UNMANNED AERIAL SYSTEMS <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HC9AAA68BA5724529A893711DC3462817" qb-display-quote="yes"> (a) In general Not later than 180 days after the date of the enactment of this Act, the Secretary of Defense shall establish and carry out an integrated set of measures— <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H7EFE56E23BBA43ECA50E8BB549DD323A" qb-display-quote="yes"> (1) to identify risks in the supply chain for small unmanned aerial systems (referred to in this section as <quote quote-display-end="auto" quote-display-start="auto" quote-type="text">sUAS); and <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H0FD9724C6EAE4C58924BBB83B7DDEA67" qb-display-quote="yes"> (2) to increase the resiliency of such sUAS supply chain using parts supplied by domestic sources and from allies and partners of the United States. <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H35D638A590FC496FB6FB65FECAD7B3FD" qb-display-quote="yes"> (b) Elements The measures carried out under subsection (a) shall include the following: <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HC60FF691EDEB45BEB46779816D891FAB" qb-display-quote="yes"> (1) Disassembly and analysis of commercially available foreign drone aircraft Not later than 90 days after the date of the enactment of this Act and not less frequently than once every three years thereafter until 2034, the Secretary of Defense shall fully disassemble a drone aircraft made by Da Jiang Innovations or a similar commercially available sUAS manufactured in a covered foreign country in order to— <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HAA286A5E3AF744758AEB1B47DAD41896" qb-display-quote="yes"> (A) create a taxonomy for each component that categorizes the component by function, level of risk, and such other criteria as the Secretary determines appropriate; and <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HAC8F5F35FFF34DAD891AF55EB984FE78" qb-display-quote="yes"> (B) help assess the risk of such components for the purposes of supply chain monitoring and visibility. <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HC17C49D17BEC42A2B1813E72092AF234" qb-display-quote="yes"> (2) Supply chain risk framework Not later than 150 days after the date of the enactment of this Act and using the taxonomy developed under paragraph (1)(A), the Secretary of Defense shall develop a supply chain risk framework in order to— <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H37302651966E4275A95BFA435F34A762" qb-display-quote="yes"> (A) assess the risk of each sUAS component to Department of Defense networks or operations; <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H94DFD2073FC849588C6222BD2100D2B8" qb-display-quote="yes"> (B) for components that present a risk as determined under subparagraph (A), identify any manufacturers of such components are based in covered foreign countries and evaluate whether measures to mitigate the risk posed by such foreign-produced components are feasible or practical; and <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HB9158B7C3D4B4BFC9DC9786F47D14623" qb-display-quote="yes"> (C) determine if any of the foreign companies in the sUAS supply chain should be included on the list maintained by the Department of Defense in accordance with section 1260H of the National Defense Authorization Act for Fiscal Year 2021 (Public Law 116–283; 10 U.S.C.

<paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H6DBAACB67C944F73B9C5D3FBB2BCB5BF" qb-display-quote="yes"> (3) Resilient supply chain strategy Not later than 180 days after the date of the enactment of this Act and based on the analyses conducted under paragraphs (1) and (2), the Secretary of Defense shall develop a strategy to develop a secure and resilient domestic and allied supply chain of critical components for sUASs, which shall include— <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HEBDD17DCAC634DD385CCADE8AC117BC2" qb-display-quote="yes"> (A) identification of sources of supply for sUAS components outside of a covered foreign country assessed to present a risk under paragraph (2)(A) and the total manufacturing capacity of such suppliers; <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H76A0CD26D27E4AF8A9E457322D8C08CD" qb-display-quote="yes"> (B) an assessment of the total requirement for sUASs of the Department of Defense; <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H262ABEED6E1D4E188E457AA55C2B9F31" qb-display-quote="yes"> (C) a plan to increase the manufacturing capacity of alternative sources of supply that can meet the requirement specified in subparagraph (B), including estimated funding needs; and <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HF06EADC5EE4042E7BB4770A539476DA7" qb-display-quote="yes"> (D) a description of how existing initiatives and programs of the Department of Defense may be used to create alternative sUAS sources of supply outside of a covered foreign country, including recommendations for— <clause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H04129B1FF97D4603941DB83F6FAD27B1" qb-display-quote="yes"> (i) using authorities available to the Department of Defense, such as Defense Production Act authorities, the Industrial Base Analysis and Sustainment program, loan guarantees, or other programs; and <clause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HBAF9A592C46A4A629AB026F08F1DED88" qb-display-quote="yes"> (ii) incentivizing private sector investment to grow or foster domestic or allied sourcing for components for sUASs. <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H96CBEBB49DA5448788214F5868B31641" qb-display-quote="yes"> (c) Report Not later than 270 days after the date of the enactment of this Act, the Secretary of Defense shall submit to the Committees on Armed Services of the Senate and the House of Representatives a report that includes— <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H40AAC27231954E58BE98CC063A38DCF6" qb-display-quote="yes"> (1) a list of each component identified under subsection (b)(1), including a description of any security vulnerabilities associated with such component; <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H4201557134744EB2835D2BED526327BF" qb-display-quote="yes"> (2) a description of the supply chain risk framework developed under subsection (b)(2); <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HBED7485A420C49AE8982DF679D824F45" qb-display-quote="yes"> (3) any recommendations for the inclusion of companies on the list described in subsection (b)(2)(C); and <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H6FD6DF4776E14FCC9B9E5417FA074E64" qb-display-quote="yes"> (4) the full strategy developed under subsection (b)(3). <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H944C571A5D1F40509BF3E8D727A1DC4D" qb-display-quote="yes"> (d) Form The report required under subsection (c) shall be submitted in unclassified form, but may include a classified annex.

<paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H68C3F91F13F043EDBAA368EDFFD05371" qb-display-quote="yes"> (4) Analysis of Viability An assessment of the viability of funding and sustaining the Program across the period covered by the most recent future-years defense program submitted to Congress under section 221 of title 10, United States Code (as of the date of the plan), considering— <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H08D0E3A910AB48A7890FEA065AAFFD01" qb-display-quote="yes"> (A) the financial impact relative to existing Army security infrastructure budgets; <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H3FF7ECB1903F4919B1C654A626D0DE2E" qb-display-quote="yes"> (B) cost-benefit analysis of upgrading existing systems versus implementing new technologies at each selected location; and <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H669545EED5504CB6B697FA763B78097F" qb-display-quote="yes"> (C) identification of technological challenges or barriers to implementing modern monitoring solutions. <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H6272B945C7B94974AEE2A2167F15BFA1" qb-display-quote="yes"> (5) Authorities A list of any additional authorities, appropriations, or other resources necessary to ensure the success of the Program. <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HAC1CA925F729480D91B64E4B73807695" qb-display-quote="yes"> (c) Submittal to Congress Not later than September 1, 2025, the Secretary of the Army shall submit to the Committees on Armed Services of the Senate and House of Representatives a completed version of the plan developed under subsection (a).

<section display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HFC4A3A4DFEA54E6BA2749262501840E4" qb-display-quote="yes" section-type="subsequent-section"> 112. PILOT PROGRAM ON THE USE OF ROBOTIC TARGETS TO ENHANCE THE LETHALITY OF THE RESERVE COMPONENTS OF THE ARMY <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H9679906CE7644BE090849B6FFEBA7976" qb-display-quote="yes"> (a) Establishment The Secretary of the Army shall carry out a pilot program under which the Secretary incorporates the use of moving robotic target systems into live fire training provided to select infantry units of the reserve and National Guard components of the Army. <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HA98C23D56EEE48638A06ECEFC5E3E4C6" qb-display-quote="yes"> (b) Designation The pilot program under subsection (a) shall be known as the <quote quote-display-end="auto" quote-display-start="auto" quote-type="text">Lethality and Warfighting Enhancement Program.

<subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HA98C23D56EEE48638A06ECEFC5E3E4C6" qb-display-quote="yes"> (b) Designation The pilot program under subsection (a) shall be known as the <quote quote-display-end="auto" quote-display-start="auto" quote-type="text">Lethality and Warfighting Enhancement Program. <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HB846E47636224395BBE5A40568340C8F" qb-display-quote="yes"> (c) Locations The Secretary of the Army shall select not fewer than three military installations at which to conduct the pilot program under subsection (a). <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H9DA4C55250214F9C962F055F802787ED" qb-display-quote="yes"> (d) Objectives The objectives of the pilot program under subsection (a) shall be— <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H19DAAE05D48E4B379DC1ADD82575ECC5" qb-display-quote="yes"> (1) to increase the lethality of the combined fighting force of the Army by providing reserve component and National Guard infantry units with the opportunity to conduct realistic live fire training on state-of-the-art moving robotic target systems; and <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H972E24C05F794006A7A3161C10520411" qb-display-quote="yes"> (2) to demonstrate the effect of such training on small arms proficiency and lethality in ground combat operations.

<subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H535991AFAF114B38B8F987DBC4FB1D7F" qb-display-quote="yes"> (i) Contract authority <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H24B1C21CC3C645D88129FFEBA27189B8" qb-display-quote="yes"> (1) In general The Secretary of the Army is authorized to enter into one or more contracts for the procurement of moving robotic target systems for use in the pilot program under subsection (a). <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H1E8DE2D7FEBC487DB6A9394C75A8ADA8" qb-display-quote="yes"> (2) Required capabilities Robotic target systems procured under paragraph (1) shall be capable of— <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HB3A39B1B216E467887CB3328E5EF1336" qb-display-quote="yes"> (A) conducting multiple realistic offensive and defensive scenarios in a single training session that are consistent with combat operations; <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H561612A8545A4FF68C3D8423A778FB4D" qb-display-quote="yes"> (B) operating in an unpredictable, realistic, and reactionary fashion; <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HA82DD9A3A2D84C3EAA0EDF57AC01FC26" qb-display-quote="yes"> (C) objectively scoring trainee performance; <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H6F8BBCD4869B43FC952854A0562A8305" qb-display-quote="yes"> (D) maneuvering across diverse geographic landscapes, including snow, ice, soft soils, extreme heat, extreme cold, wooded terrain and offroad areas; <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HE5DA150454F3463D83FAC32CCAFC6A9E" qb-display-quote="yes"> (E) operating at distances greater than 100 yards from the range operator; <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H139C344C105447B2AA5D76A10C4AD22D" qb-display-quote="yes"> (F) surviving live fire from 6.8 mm rounds and the Next Generation Squad Weapon of the Army; and <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H08238585AE004D5AA9E440956FFFD694" qb-display-quote="yes"> (G) fully functioning in all reasonably expected weather conditions. <section display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H94AC8F99A42E4916BB76F8DE07F57ED2" qb-display-quote="yes" section-type="subsequent-section"> 113.

<subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H535991AFAF114B38B8F987DBC4FB1D7F" qb-display-quote="yes"> (i) Contract authority <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H24B1C21CC3C645D88129FFEBA27189B8" qb-display-quote="yes"> (1) In general The Secretary of the Army is authorized to enter into one or more contracts for the procurement of moving robotic target systems for use in the pilot program under subsection (a). <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H1E8DE2D7FEBC487DB6A9394C75A8ADA8" qb-display-quote="yes"> (2) Required capabilities Robotic target systems procured under paragraph (1) shall be capable of— <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HB3A39B1B216E467887CB3328E5EF1336" qb-display-quote="yes"> (A) conducting multiple realistic offensive and defensive scenarios in a single training session that are consistent with combat operations; <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H561612A8545A4FF68C3D8423A778FB4D" qb-display-quote="yes"> (B) operating in an unpredictable, realistic, and reactionary fashion; <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HA82DD9A3A2D84C3EAA0EDF57AC01FC26" qb-display-quote="yes"> (C) objectively scoring trainee performance; <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H6F8BBCD4869B43FC952854A0562A8305" qb-display-quote="yes"> (D) maneuvering across diverse geographic landscapes, including snow, ice, soft soils, extreme heat, extreme cold, wooded terrain and offroad areas; <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HE5DA150454F3463D83FAC32CCAFC6A9E" qb-display-quote="yes"> (E) operating at distances greater than 100 yards from the range operator; <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H139C344C105447B2AA5D76A10C4AD22D" qb-display-quote="yes"> (F) surviving live fire from 6.8 mm rounds and the Next Generation Squad Weapon of the Army; and <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H08238585AE004D5AA9E440956FFFD694" qb-display-quote="yes"> (G) fully functioning in all reasonably expected weather conditions. <section display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H94AC8F99A42E4916BB76F8DE07F57ED2" qb-display-quote="yes" section-type="subsequent-section"> 113.

<section display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H205B9A22A7ED4C4D99680BA90FFFDA3F" qb-display-quote="yes" section-type="subsequent-section"> 130. LIMITATION ON STRUCTURAL IMPROVEMENTS AND ELECTRICAL POWER UPGRADES FOR AH–1Z AND UH–1Y HELICOPTERS <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H61113AF53E9748CD9A720B1F3FB81E3F" qb-display-quote="yes"> (a) Limitation The Secretary of the Navy may not carry out covered upgrades to AH–1Z Viper and UH–1Y Venom helicopters at a location other than a facility owned by the original equipment manufacturer for such helicopters until the date on which the Secretary certifies to the Committees on Armed Services of the Senate and the House of Representatives that the plan for carrying out covered upgrades at location other than a facility owned by the original equipment manufacturer is expected— <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H0ACF379DCAF64500AA2F2419DCB7459B" qb-display-quote="yes"> (1) to result in levels of performance, survivability, lethality, interoperability, mission execution, and overall safety of the helicopter platform that match or exceed the levels that would otherwise be achievable by completing such upgrades at a facility owned by the original equipment manufacturer for the model of helicopter involved; <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H379594F86E0148E2BB9D65A56A8E20A7" qb-display-quote="yes"> (2) to provide improved onboard electrical power capacity and ensure adequate power margin for integrating future capabilities; <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H06661D0A10C44EB6A4AE7F35295780F3" qb-display-quote="yes"> (3) to improve and expand future weapons interfaces; and <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HBB50403A03CA4B28BD0CFC6C6EA55F46" qb-display-quote="yes"> (4) to allow for improved ease of maintenance. <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H39369D8C706347A3B38EB7626F4D2527" qb-display-quote="yes"> (b) Covered upgrades In this section, the term <quote quote-display-end="auto" quote-display-start="auto" quote-type="text">covered upgrades means any structural improvements or electrical power upgrades for AH–1Z Viper or UH–1Y Venom helicopters.

MANAGEMENT OF TEMPORARY RELOCATION OF B–1 BOMBER AIRCRAFT AND PERSONNEL Section 133 of the National Defense Authorization Act for Fiscal Year 2022 (Public Law 117–81; 135 Stat. 1574), as most recently amended by section 136 of the National Defense Authorization Act for Fiscal Year 2024 (Public Law 118–31; 137 Stat. 174), is further amended— <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H18B0AF9BA83C43ED90AC4239139755F1" qb-display-quote="yes"> (1) by redesignating subsection (c) as subsection (d); and <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H3A1C588D7CFB41C09691008E33425B17" qb-display-quote="yes"> (2) by inserting after subsection (b) the following new subsection (c): <quoted-block display-end-quotes="yes" display-inline="no-display-inline" display-quotes="yes" id="H8D51C1FBC1C448F090297E2E696308A5" style="OLC"> <section display-inline="no-display-inline" id="d1e4701" qb-display-quote="yes" section-type="subsequent-section"> <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HE79EA103A66A4A8582FD59D896E3703E" qb-display-quote="yes"> (c) Temporary relocation The Secretary of the Air Force shall, to the extent practicable, manage the temporary relocation of any B–1 bomber aircraft or personnel assigned to units responsible for the operation and maintenance of such aircraft resulting from planned military construction in a manner that— <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H4BABF110BD1B49CA85CD413A48612956" qb-display-quote="yes"> (1) minimizes effects to combat readiness; <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HE4E0A434E26046089F7E29244D6E161E" qb-display-quote="yes"> (2) mitigates the risk of concentrating a significant number of the total B–1 bomber fleet at one location; <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H2573DF7EBBCD49DBB10BAE05F38CBED7" qb-display-quote="yes"> (3) uses the construction period to maximize expeditionary actions such as through Bomber Task Force and Agile Combat Employment; and <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HD542DCF5CC434236A0AB0064D7130A4C" qb-display-quote="yes"> (4) takes into consideration travel options and travel distance for families and dependents of such personnel.

<paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H8DCE4B48A99749019EC2165414C42D2E" qb-display-quote="yes"> (3) Reports and briefing to congress Not later than March 15, 2026, the Secretary of Defense shall— <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HA773038208B34EBC91AFC7AAF6567C4C" qb-display-quote="yes"> (A) submit to the congressional defense committees an unaltered copy of the report received by the Secretary under paragraph (2); <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H9B81162C6D7E49AFBD7DFC8156A71624" qb-display-quote="yes"> (B) submit to such committees a separate report on the views of the Secretary with respect to the results of the study and analysis carried out under paragraph (1), which shall include— <clause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H4C11993E128042A9B34FE8B76F07A6A3" qb-display-quote="yes"> (i) a detailed explanation of the strategy and methodology used to conduct the study and analysis, including any force sizing and shaping constructs, scenarios, and assumptions used as part of such study and analysis; and <clause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HF2BAD689C33241A9A5BC0FBA340055DA" qb-display-quote="yes"> (ii) assessed operational risk based on the Chairman of the Joint Chiefs of Staff risk management classifications set forth the most recent version of the Chairman of the Joint Chiefs of Staff Manual 3105.01A, titled <quote quote-display-end="auto" quote-display-start="auto" quote-type="text">Joint Risk Analysis Methodology; and <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H79B56357760F4A21A83EA4E09068DE2C" qb-display-quote="yes"> (C) provide a briefing to the committees on such results. <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HCDEEEE48B7BB4F72B890ECF82D8CC89D" qb-display-quote="yes"> (c) Definitions In this section, the term <quote quote-display-end="auto" quote-display-start="auto" quote-type="text">fighter aircraft means— <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H7BE7AFB667824798913619DCBEF40FDF" qb-display-quote="yes"> (1) F–15, F–16, F–22, and F–35 aircraft; and <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HFD35A7C00F6A4DD1A85774EB50810439" qb-display-quote="yes"> (2) the Next Generation Air Dominance piloted combat aircraft. <section display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H701BBCF58B0C45B8B0D248FC8479DBDF" qb-display-quote="yes" section-type="subsequent-section"> 151.

113 note). <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H6DBAACB67C944F73B9C5D3FBB2BCB5BF" qb-display-quote="yes"> (3) Resilient supply chain strategy Not later than 180 days after the date of the enactment of this Act and based on the analyses conducted under paragraphs (1) and (2), the Secretary of Defense shall develop a strategy to develop a secure and resilient domestic and allied supply chain of critical components for sUASs, which shall include— <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HEBDD17DCAC634DD385CCADE8AC117BC2" qb-display-quote="yes"> (A) identification of sources of supply for sUAS components outside of a covered foreign country assessed to present a risk under paragraph (2)(A) and the total manufacturing capacity of such suppliers; <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H76A0CD26D27E4AF8A9E457322D8C08CD" qb-display-quote="yes"> (B) an assessment of the total requirement for sUASs of the Department of Defense; <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H262ABEED6E1D4E188E457AA55C2B9F31" qb-display-quote="yes"> (C) a plan to increase the manufacturing capacity of alternative sources of supply that can meet the requirement specified in subparagraph (B), including estimated funding needs; and <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HF06EADC5EE4042E7BB4770A539476DA7" qb-display-quote="yes"> (D) a description of how existing initiatives and programs of the Department of Defense may be used to create alternative sUAS sources of supply outside of a covered foreign country, including recommendations for— <clause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H04129B1FF97D4603941DB83F6FAD27B1" qb-display-quote="yes"> (i) using authorities available to the Department of Defense, such as Defense Production Act authorities, the Industrial Base Analysis and Sustainment program, loan guarantees, or other programs; and <clause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HBAF9A592C46A4A629AB026F08F1DED88" qb-display-quote="yes"> (ii) incentivizing private sector investment to grow or foster domestic or allied sourcing for components for sUASs. <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H96CBEBB49DA5448788214F5868B31641" qb-display-quote="yes"> (c) Report Not later than 270 days after the date of the enactment of this Act, the Secretary of Defense shall submit to the Committees on Armed Services of the Senate and the House of Representatives a report that includes— <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H40AAC27231954E58BE98CC063A38DCF6" qb-display-quote="yes"> (1) a list of each component identified under subsection (b)(1), including a description of any security vulnerabilities associated with such component; <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H4201557134744EB2835D2BED526327BF" qb-display-quote="yes"> (2) a description of the supply chain risk framework developed under subsection (b)(2); <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HBED7485A420C49AE8982DF679D824F45" qb-display-quote="yes"> (3) any recommendations for the inclusion of companies on the list described in subsection (b)(2)(C); and <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H6FD6DF4776E14FCC9B9E5417FA074E64" qb-display-quote="yes"> (4) the full strategy developed under subsection (b)(3).

113 note). <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H6DBAACB67C944F73B9C5D3FBB2BCB5BF" qb-display-quote="yes"> (3) Resilient supply chain strategy Not later than 180 days after the date of the enactment of this Act and based on the analyses conducted under paragraphs (1) and (2), the Secretary of Defense shall develop a strategy to develop a secure and resilient domestic and allied supply chain of critical components for sUASs, which shall include— <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HEBDD17DCAC634DD385CCADE8AC117BC2" qb-display-quote="yes"> (A) identification of sources of supply for sUAS components outside of a covered foreign country assessed to present a risk under paragraph (2)(A) and the total manufacturing capacity of such suppliers; and <clause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HBAF9A592C46A4A629AB026F08F1DED88" qb-display-quote="yes"> (ii) incentivizing private sector investment to grow or foster domestic or allied sourcing for components for sUASs. <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H96CBEBB49DA5448788214F5868B31641" qb-display-quote="yes"> (c) Report Not later than 270 days after the date of the enactment of this Act, the Secretary of Defense shall submit to the Committees on Armed Services of the Senate and the House of Representatives a report that includes— <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H40AAC27231954E58BE98CC063A38DCF6" qb-display-quote="yes"> (1) a list of each component identified under subsection (b)(1), including a description of any security vulnerabilities associated with such component; <!DOCTYPE publaw SYSTEM "cq-dscs-exchange-publaw.dtd"> <publaw bill-num="hr5009" congress="118" corrected-print="no" document-type="enr" pl-num="118-159" public-private="public" session="2" stat-page="1773" stat-vol="138" version-date="20241223"> Servicemember Quality of Life Improvement and National Defense Authorization Act for Fiscal Year 2025 Spectrum and Secure Technology and Innovation Act of 2024 Public Law 118-159 138 STAT. 1773 118th Congress December 23, 2024 [H. R. 5009] AN ACT To authorize appropriations for fiscal year 2025 for military activities of the Department of Defense, for military construction, and for defense activities of the Department of Energy, to prescribe military personnel strengths for such fiscal year, and for other purposes. Be it enacted by the Senate and House of Representatives of the United States of America in Congress assembled, <section display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H3087FFC3843B40EAA7B97E86855D82E3" qb-display-quote="yes" section-type="section-one"> 1.

These locations shall— <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H16A2440EEB6B49998CB7E93C7E2160C6" qb-display-quote="yes"> (A) serve as the primary hubs for the continuous monitoring of installation security across all installations of the Department of the Army in the United States; <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H4E26FAB0C5FA408A9ED3CB2B31B28452" qb-display-quote="yes"> (B) represent a mix of large and extra-large facilities, as defined by the 2016 business case analysis conducted by the Provost Marshal General of the Army; and <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HAF80BFC23FE6463D9D031A3CD38530A4" qb-display-quote="yes"> (C) be chosen based on geographical diversity and their strategic importance to the Army’s overall security infrastructure. <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H405DEDE0D90F442CA9963846F464A218" qb-display-quote="yes"> (3) Cost A comprehensive breakdown of the full costs of the Program, including— <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HDD9871D21E804E1AAC2851E9EEC06670" qb-display-quote="yes"> (A) initial capital expenditure for system implementation; <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HC14A65C43067400D84CDAE99014255F4" qb-display-quote="yes"> (B) the cost of networking all installations and facilities across the Department of the Army within the United States; <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HDF17CCF2C44F4BF2AD39795B9DFA5F8B" qb-display-quote="yes"> (C) estimated operation and maintenance costs; <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H30ECE32CD2A24C31A0306579E9D71434" qb-display-quote="yes"> (D) a detailed funding schedule with expenditures projected across the period covered by the most recent future-years defense program submitted to Congress under section 221 of title 10, United States Code (as of the date of the plan); and <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H535267D15CF044BD87210DE59534BC71" qb-display-quote="yes"> (E) identification of potential cost-saving opportunities from the consolidation of current security monitoring systems. <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H68C3F91F13F043EDBAA368EDFFD05371" qb-display-quote="yes"> (4) Analysis of Viability An assessment of the viability of funding and sustaining the Program across the period covered by the most recent future-years defense program submitted to Congress under section 221 of title 10, United States Code (as of the date of the plan), considering— <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H08D0E3A910AB48A7890FEA065AAFFD01" qb-display-quote="yes"> (A) the financial impact relative to existing Army security infrastructure budgets; <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H3FF7ECB1903F4919B1C654A626D0DE2E" qb-display-quote="yes"> (B) cost-benefit analysis of upgrading existing systems versus implementing new technologies at each selected location; and <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H669545EED5504CB6B697FA763B78097F" qb-display-quote="yes"> (C) identification of technological challenges or barriers to implementing modern monitoring solutions.
