<section display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HFC4A3A4DFEA54E6BA2749262501840E4" qb-display-quote="yes" section-type="subsequent-section"> 112. PILOT PROGRAM ON THE USE OF ROBOTIC TARGETS TO ENHANCE THE LETHALITY OF THE RESERVE COMPONENTS OF THE ARMY <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H9679906CE7644BE090849B6FFEBA7976" qb-display-quote="yes"> (a) Establishment The Secretary of the Army shall carry out a pilot program under which the Secretary incorporates the use of moving robotic target systems into live fire training provided to select infantry units of the reserve and National Guard components of the Army. <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HA98C23D56EEE48638A06ECEFC5E3E4C6" qb-display-quote="yes"> (b) Designation The pilot program under subsection (a) shall be known as the <quote quote-display-end="auto" quote-display-start="auto" quote-type="text">Lethality and Warfighting Enhancement Program.

<subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H9DA4C55250214F9C962F055F802787ED" qb-display-quote="yes"> (d) Objectives The objectives of the pilot program under subsection (a) shall be— <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H19DAAE05D48E4B379DC1ADD82575ECC5" qb-display-quote="yes"> (1) to increase the lethality of the combined fighting force of the Army by providing reserve component and National Guard infantry units with the opportunity to conduct realistic live fire training on state-of-the-art moving robotic target systems; and <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H972E24C05F794006A7A3161C10520411" qb-display-quote="yes"> (2) to demonstrate the effect of such training on small arms proficiency and lethality in ground combat operations. <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H75420C0FFC3D4A99ACF34FB032B801FF" qb-display-quote="yes"> (e) Selection of participating units The Secretary of the Army shall select infantry units of the reserve components of the Army to participate in the pilot program under subsection (a) taking into consideration— <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H12B8836C3FC144FD9F3FEA39DDE2DF6F" qb-display-quote="yes"> (1) the past performance of the unit; <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H5116B9F4334047F0A0C8888B6BED8DFE" qb-display-quote="yes"> (2) the readiness status of the unit, with an emphasis on providing training to those units designated as preparing to deploy or at a similarly designated readiness status; and <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H3ED5E8E858D14217AF97041B47C98944" qb-display-quote="yes"> (3) the likelihood that a unit would be actively deployed or commanded to conduct decisive action. <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H97D0E2B3DC444353852EC41883AF3C9D" qb-display-quote="yes"> (f) Commencement The Secretary of the Army shall commence the pilot program under subsection (a) not later than 180 days after the date of the enactment of this Act.

<subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H535991AFAF114B38B8F987DBC4FB1D7F" qb-display-quote="yes"> (i) Contract authority <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H24B1C21CC3C645D88129FFEBA27189B8" qb-display-quote="yes"> (1) In general The Secretary of the Army is authorized to enter into one or more contracts for the procurement of moving robotic target systems for use in the pilot program under subsection (a). <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H1E8DE2D7FEBC487DB6A9394C75A8ADA8" qb-display-quote="yes"> (2) Required capabilities Robotic target systems procured under paragraph (1) shall be capable of— <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HB3A39B1B216E467887CB3328E5EF1336" qb-display-quote="yes"> (A) conducting multiple realistic offensive and defensive scenarios in a single training session that are consistent with combat operations; <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H561612A8545A4FF68C3D8423A778FB4D" qb-display-quote="yes"> (B) operating in an unpredictable, realistic, and reactionary fashion; <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HA82DD9A3A2D84C3EAA0EDF57AC01FC26" qb-display-quote="yes"> (C) objectively scoring trainee performance; <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H6F8BBCD4869B43FC952854A0562A8305" qb-display-quote="yes"> (D) maneuvering across diverse geographic landscapes, including snow, ice, soft soils, extreme heat, extreme cold, wooded terrain and offroad areas; <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HE5DA150454F3463D83FAC32CCAFC6A9E" qb-display-quote="yes"> (E) operating at distances greater than 100 yards from the range operator; <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H139C344C105447B2AA5D76A10C4AD22D" qb-display-quote="yes"> (F) surviving live fire from 6.8 mm rounds and the Next Generation Squad Weapon of the Army; and <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H08238585AE004D5AA9E440956FFFD694" qb-display-quote="yes"> (G) fully functioning in all reasonably expected weather conditions. <section display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H94AC8F99A42E4916BB76F8DE07F57ED2" qb-display-quote="yes" section-type="subsequent-section"> 113.

<subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H97AC07A779F947BCBCB61CF140A16451" qb-display-quote="yes"> (b) Program element The Secretary of the Navy shall ensure, within budget program elements for the Navy, that there is a dedicated program element for the development and acquisition of surface and underwater dual-modality, advanced autonomous vehicles. <section display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HB1E72B10C9BA46E3971CCCCE80542359" qb-display-quote="yes" section-type="subsequent-section"> 126. MULTIYEAR PROCUREMENT AUTHORITY FOR CH–53K AIRCRAFT AND T408 ENGINES <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HCAD37AAA66724FF0976666307CB570FE" qb-display-quote="yes"> (a) Authority for multiyear procurement Subject to section 3501 of title 10, United States Code, the Secretary of the Navy may enter into one or more multiyear contracts, beginning with the fiscal year 2025 program year, for the procurement of the following: <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H970DCDBB63A741379B2B8B370FDA05B2" qb-display-quote="yes"> (1) CH–53K aircraft.

<section display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H205B9A22A7ED4C4D99680BA90FFFDA3F" qb-display-quote="yes" section-type="subsequent-section"> 130. LIMITATION ON STRUCTURAL IMPROVEMENTS AND ELECTRICAL POWER UPGRADES FOR AH–1Z AND UH–1Y HELICOPTERS <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H61113AF53E9748CD9A720B1F3FB81E3F" qb-display-quote="yes"> (a) Limitation The Secretary of the Navy may not carry out covered upgrades to AH–1Z Viper and UH–1Y Venom helicopters at a location other than a facility owned by the original equipment manufacturer for such helicopters until the date on which the Secretary certifies to the Committees on Armed Services of the Senate and the House of Representatives that the plan for carrying out covered upgrades at location other than a facility owned by the original equipment manufacturer is expected— <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H0ACF379DCAF64500AA2F2419DCB7459B" qb-display-quote="yes"> (1) to result in levels of performance, survivability, lethality, interoperability, mission execution, and overall safety of the helicopter platform that match or exceed the levels that would otherwise be achievable by completing such upgrades at a facility owned by the original equipment manufacturer for the model of helicopter involved; <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H379594F86E0148E2BB9D65A56A8E20A7" qb-display-quote="yes"> (2) to provide improved onboard electrical power capacity and ensure adequate power margin for integrating future capabilities; <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H06661D0A10C44EB6A4AE7F35295780F3" qb-display-quote="yes"> (3) to improve and expand future weapons interfaces; and <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HBB50403A03CA4B28BD0CFC6C6EA55F46" qb-display-quote="yes"> (4) to allow for improved ease of maintenance. <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H39369D8C706347A3B38EB7626F4D2527" qb-display-quote="yes"> (b) Covered upgrades In this section, the term <quote quote-display-end="auto" quote-display-start="auto" quote-type="text">covered upgrades means any structural improvements or electrical power upgrades for AH–1Z Viper or UH–1Y Venom helicopters.

<section display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H205B9A22A7ED4C4D99680BA90FFFDA3F" qb-display-quote="yes" section-type="subsequent-section"> 130. LIMITATION ON STRUCTURAL IMPROVEMENTS AND ELECTRICAL POWER UPGRADES FOR AH–1Z AND UH–1Y HELICOPTERS <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H61113AF53E9748CD9A720B1F3FB81E3F" qb-display-quote="yes"> (a) Limitation The Secretary of the Navy may not carry out covered upgrades to AH–1Z Viper and UH–1Y Venom helicopters at a location other than a facility owned by the original equipment manufacturer for such helicopters until the date on which the Secretary certifies to the Committees on Armed Services of the Senate and the House of Representatives that the plan for carrying out covered upgrades at location other than a facility owned by the original equipment manufacturer is expected— <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H0ACF379DCAF64500AA2F2419DCB7459B" qb-display-quote="yes"> (1) to result in levels of performance, survivability, lethality, interoperability, mission execution, and overall safety of the helicopter platform that match or exceed the levels that would otherwise be achievable by completing such upgrades at a facility owned by the original equipment manufacturer for the model of helicopter involved; <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H379594F86E0148E2BB9D65A56A8E20A7" qb-display-quote="yes"> (2) to provide improved onboard electrical power capacity and ensure adequate power margin for integrating future capabilities; <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H06661D0A10C44EB6A4AE7F35295780F3" qb-display-quote="yes"> (3) to improve and expand future weapons interfaces; and <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HBB50403A03CA4B28BD0CFC6C6EA55F46" qb-display-quote="yes"> (4) to allow for improved ease of maintenance. <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H39369D8C706347A3B38EB7626F4D2527" qb-display-quote="yes"> (b) Covered upgrades In this section, the term <quote quote-display-end="auto" quote-display-start="auto" quote-type="text">covered upgrades means any structural improvements or electrical power upgrades for AH–1Z Viper or UH–1Y Venom helicopters.

<section display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H50E504EBB56B4D6AB32195C3D6CBAC35" qb-display-quote="yes" section-type="subsequent-section"> 131. ANNUAL REPORT ON SURFACE SHIP SUPPLIERS <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HF748861A598D4E99B52D3F8B9FA803A7" qb-display-quote="yes"> (a) In general Not later than 180 days after the date of the enactment of this Act, and once every fiscal year thereafter through September 30, 2029, the Secretary of the Navy shall submit to the congressional defense committees a report analyzing suppliers of components for surface ships of the Navy. <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H23DF4BB118D14444B3D54C3E9CAE4B5B" qb-display-quote="yes"> (b) Elements Each report required by subsection (a) shall include the following: <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H203C4BFB9CBE4C70A8CE606D4CC1AC35" qb-display-quote="yes"> (1) An assessment of the status of each supplier of surface ship components using the same or a similar methodology to that used in the Navy’s evaluation tool for suppliers of components for Columbia-class submarines.

<subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H23DF4BB118D14444B3D54C3E9CAE4B5B" qb-display-quote="yes"> (b) Elements Each report required by subsection (a) shall include the following: <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H203C4BFB9CBE4C70A8CE606D4CC1AC35" qb-display-quote="yes"> (1) An assessment of the status of each supplier of surface ship components using the same or a similar methodology to that used in the Navy’s evaluation tool for suppliers of components for Columbia-class submarines. <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H86153D06206047D89FD7A344E6C256A2" qb-display-quote="yes"> (2) If the assessment described in paragraph (1) indicates that the supply base of any surface ship component is in an at-risk status, a plan for actions to stabilize that supply base. <subtitle id="H8548E0342D3F4157A2C6EACD3A4B43C6" qb-display-quote="yes" style="OLC"> D Air Force Programs <section display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HAFE9E2661A3545EEB598F007EE747E3D" qb-display-quote="yes" section-type="subsequent-section"> 141.

<subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HFE7CB156C79043158853FFC59082ECA7" qb-display-quote="yes"> (b) Implementation plan Not later than 120 days after the date of the enactment of this Act, the Secretary of the Air Force shall develop and initiate an implementation plan for the transfers required under subsection (a). <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HB95E7F79447F4C1E90E3291203A8EF58" qb-display-quote="yes"> (c) Report Not later than 30 days after completing the development of the implementation plan required under subsection (b), the Secretary of the Air Force shall submit to the Committees on Armed Services of the House of Representatives and the Senate a report that includes a description of— <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H959CEBD49555439CB088F8884A0DCD2F" qb-display-quote="yes"> (1) the planned milestones for execution of the implementation plan; <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H68B3F39535FE4636B604776DA6DAF1AB" qb-display-quote="yes"> (2) any data, staff, and funding needed to effectively carry out such plan; and <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H45FB5CBDA9BE41DAA5C376F750956DC8" qb-display-quote="yes"> (3) the progress of the Secretary in meeting such milestones as of the date of the report. <section display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H951539F4237F453199DA5A122DF566FC" qb-display-quote="yes" section-type="subsequent-section"> 148.

<paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HE9A0A61C222745B4AEE50B668ADEEC2C" qb-display-quote="yes"> (3) Relationship to other law The prohibition under paragraph (1) supercedes any provision of section 9062(l) of title 10, United States Code, that is inconsistent with such prohibition. <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HDCC653A1BB94419FA93CEA6D09EFF786" qb-display-quote="yes"> (b) Fighter aircraft capabilities and requirements study <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H097D63A2404C47D1A0550DE16DDE8B11" qb-display-quote="yes"> (1) Study The Secretary of Defense shall seek to enter into a contract or other agreement with a federally funded research and development center pursuant to which the center shall carry out— <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H8940A8C963B2466EBDB8E8BDC5099D06" qb-display-quote="yes"> (A) an analysis of the fighter aircraft procurement, fielding, and divestment plan of the Department of the Air Force, as submitted to Congress in accordance with section 148 of the National Defense Authorization Act for Fiscal Year 2024 (Public Law 118–31; 137 Stat. 178); and <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H66AA9F3D29B64051AF08DD58B3C4B2E2" qb-display-quote="yes"> (B) a fighter aircraft capability and requirements study that estimates the number of fighter aircraft needed by the Air Force to meet the requirements of combatant commanders.

<paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H07DC7E5FA22E4348A7DBE3422C36F998" qb-display-quote="yes"> (2) Report to secretary The federally funded research and development center that carries out the study and analysis under paragraph (1) shall submit to the Secretary of Defense a report on the results of such study and analysis. <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H8DCE4B48A99749019EC2165414C42D2E" qb-display-quote="yes"> (3) Reports and briefing to congress Not later than March 15, 2026, the Secretary of Defense shall— <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HA773038208B34EBC91AFC7AAF6567C4C" qb-display-quote="yes"> (A) submit to the congressional defense committees an unaltered copy of the report received by the Secretary under paragraph (2); <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H9B81162C6D7E49AFBD7DFC8156A71624" qb-display-quote="yes"> (B) submit to such committees a separate report on the views of the Secretary with respect to the results of the study and analysis carried out under paragraph (1), which shall include— <clause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H4C11993E128042A9B34FE8B76F07A6A3" qb-display-quote="yes"> (i) a detailed explanation of the strategy and methodology used to conduct the study and analysis, including any force sizing and shaping constructs, scenarios, and assumptions used as part of such study and analysis; and <clause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HF2BAD689C33241A9A5BC0FBA340055DA" qb-display-quote="yes"> (ii) assessed operational risk based on the Chairman of the Joint Chiefs of Staff risk management classifications set forth the most recent version of the Chairman of the Joint Chiefs of Staff Manual 3105.01A, titled <quote quote-display-end="auto" quote-display-start="auto" quote-type="text">Joint Risk Analysis Methodology; and <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H79B56357760F4A21A83EA4E09068DE2C" qb-display-quote="yes"> (C) provide a briefing to the committees on such results. <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HCDEEEE48B7BB4F72B890ECF82D8CC89D" qb-display-quote="yes"> (c) Definitions In this section, the term <quote quote-display-end="auto" quote-display-start="auto" quote-type="text">fighter aircraft means— <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H7BE7AFB667824798913619DCBEF40FDF" qb-display-quote="yes"> (1) F–15, F–16, F–22, and F–35 aircraft; and <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HFD35A7C00F6A4DD1A85774EB50810439" qb-display-quote="yes"> (2) the Next Generation Air Dominance piloted combat aircraft.

<section display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H0794D4A712284F4CA17416A050640BD0" qb-display-quote="yes" section-type="subsequent-section"> 163. POLICY ON QUALIFICATIONS OF CONTRACTORS FOR INTO-PLANE FUEL DELIVERIES FOR HEAVY-LIFT AIRCRAFT <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H3E88A576A5F0421496B511208D176BFE" qb-display-quote="yes"> (a) Establishment of policy Not later than one year after the date of the enactment of this Act, the Director of the Defense Logistics Agency shall develop and implement a policy pursuant to which acquisition planning shall be performed for any contract providing for the into-plane procurement for heavy-lift aircraft of an estimated 5,000,000 gallons or more of aviation fuel per year within the continental United States. <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H9F86291000F249A788345824E01F1EB1" qb-display-quote="yes"> (b) Use of evaluation factors As part of the acquisition planning required under subsection (a), the Director of the Defense Logistics Agency shall determine whether to use evaluation factors to assess the qualifications of fixed-based operators bidding on contracts described in such subsection.

<subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H94FE8A19C35A4F18A241AF04DC641D0C" qb-display-quote="yes"> (h) Briefings Not later than 90 days after concluding activities under the pilot program at a military installation selected under subsection (c), the Secretary of the Army shall provide to the Committees on Armed Services of the Senate and the House of Representatives a briefing that includes a description of— <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H756B7D936EC447D0B2F5FB14306E019A" qb-display-quote="yes"> (1) the manner in which the program was conducted at such installation; and <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H057BC9B38F1C41D8909199C02CCE76A0" qb-display-quote="yes"> (2) any results achieved under the program at such installation. <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H535991AFAF114B38B8F987DBC4FB1D7F" qb-display-quote="yes"> (i) Contract authority <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H24B1C21CC3C645D88129FFEBA27189B8" qb-display-quote="yes"> (1) In general The Secretary of the Army is authorized to enter into one or more contracts for the procurement of moving robotic target systems for use in the pilot program under subsection (a). <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H1E8DE2D7FEBC487DB6A9394C75A8ADA8" qb-display-quote="yes"> (2) Required capabilities Robotic target systems procured under paragraph (1) shall be capable of— <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HB3A39B1B216E467887CB3328E5EF1336" qb-display-quote="yes"> (A) conducting multiple realistic offensive and defensive scenarios in a single training session that are consistent with combat operations; <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H561612A8545A4FF68C3D8423A778FB4D" qb-display-quote="yes"> (B) operating in an unpredictable, realistic, and reactionary fashion; <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HA82DD9A3A2D84C3EAA0EDF57AC01FC26" qb-display-quote="yes"> (C) objectively scoring trainee performance; <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H6F8BBCD4869B43FC952854A0562A8305" qb-display-quote="yes"> (D) maneuvering across diverse geographic landscapes, including snow, ice, soft soils, extreme heat, extreme cold, wooded terrain and offroad areas; <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HE5DA150454F3463D83FAC32CCAFC6A9E" qb-display-quote="yes"> (E) operating at distances greater than 100 yards from the range operator; <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H139C344C105447B2AA5D76A10C4AD22D" qb-display-quote="yes"> (F) surviving live fire from 6.8 mm rounds and the Next Generation Squad Weapon of the Army; and <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H08238585AE004D5AA9E440956FFFD694" qb-display-quote="yes"> (G) fully functioning in all reasonably expected weather conditions.

<subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H94FE8A19C35A4F18A241AF04DC641D0C" qb-display-quote="yes"> (h) Briefings Not later than 90 days after concluding activities under the pilot program at a military installation selected under subsection (c), the Secretary of the Army shall provide to the Committees on Armed Services of the Senate and the House of Representatives a briefing that includes a description of— <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H756B7D936EC447D0B2F5FB14306E019A" qb-display-quote="yes"> (1) the manner in which the program was conducted at such installation; and <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H057BC9B38F1C41D8909199C02CCE76A0" qb-display-quote="yes"> (2) any results achieved under the program at such installation. <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H535991AFAF114B38B8F987DBC4FB1D7F" qb-display-quote="yes"> (i) Contract authority <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H24B1C21CC3C645D88129FFEBA27189B8" qb-display-quote="yes"> (1) In general The Secretary of the Army is authorized to enter into one or more contracts for the procurement of moving robotic target systems for use in the pilot program under subsection (a). <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H1E8DE2D7FEBC487DB6A9394C75A8ADA8" qb-display-quote="yes"> (2) Required capabilities Robotic target systems procured under paragraph (1) shall be capable of— <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HB3A39B1B216E467887CB3328E5EF1336" qb-display-quote="yes"> (A) conducting multiple realistic offensive and defensive scenarios in a single training session that are consistent with combat operations; <section display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HFAAF93CF9CE2431D99BF7AF6630A9583" qb-display-quote="yes" section-type="subsequent-section"> 125. DESIGNATION OF OFFICIAL RESPONSIBLE FOR AUTONOMOUS SURFACE AND UNDERWATER DUAL-MODALITY VEHICLES <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H9425E3124958498DA6CE7251554BC5F4" qb-display-quote="yes"> (a) Designation required Not later than 180 days after the date of the enactment of this Act, the Secretary of the Navy shall designate an appropriate official within the Department of the Navy to have primary responsibility for the development and acquisition of surface and underwater dual-modality, advanced autonomous vehicles, consistent with warfighter requirements. <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H97AC07A779F947BCBCB61CF140A16451" qb-display-quote="yes"> (b) Program element The Secretary of the Navy shall ensure, within budget program elements for the Navy, that there is a dedicated program element for the development and acquisition of surface and underwater dual-modality, advanced autonomous vehicles.

<section display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HFAAF93CF9CE2431D99BF7AF6630A9583" qb-display-quote="yes" section-type="subsequent-section"> 125. MODIFICATION TO AIR FORCE AND NAVY USE OF COMMERCIAL DUAL-USE PARTS IN CERTAIN AIRCRAFT AND ENGINES Section 161 of the National Defense Authorization Act for Fiscal Year 2023 (Public Law 117–263; 10 U.S.C. 3453 note) is amended— <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H644CA35B4CF44E4E964F090FF97A0A69" qb-display-quote="yes"> (1) in the section heading, by striking <quote quote-display-end="auto" quote-display-start="auto" quote-type="text"> used ; <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H3BD4202755814168BD0C443927613C99" qb-display-quote="yes"> (2) in subsection (a)(1), by inserting <quote quote-display-end="auto" quote-display-start="auto" quote-type="text">new, before <quote quote-display-end="auto" quote-display-start="auto" quote-type="text">used; and <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H980EBF994407452295D4D3A336863A40" qb-display-quote="yes"> (3) in subsection (b)(2), by inserting <quote quote-display-end="auto" quote-display-start="auto" quote-type="text">, or from a certified production approval holder pursuant to part 21 of title 14, Code of Federal Regulations before the period at the end. <section display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HC62B9C3A6A5C4FCE95178E9FD9EB2F9D" qb-display-quote="yes" section-type="subsequent-section"> 162.

MEASURES TO INCREASE SUPPLY CHAIN RESILIENCY FOR SMALL UNMANNED AERIAL SYSTEMS <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HC9AAA68BA5724529A893711DC3462817" qb-display-quote="yes"> (a) In general Not later than 180 days after the date of the enactment of this Act, the Secretary of Defense shall establish and carry out an integrated set of measures— <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H7EFE56E23BBA43ECA50E8BB549DD323A" qb-display-quote="yes"> (1) to identify risks in the supply chain for small unmanned aerial systems (referred to in this section as <quote quote-display-end="auto" quote-display-start="auto" quote-type="text">sUAS); and <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H0FD9724C6EAE4C58924BBB83B7DDEA67" qb-display-quote="yes"> (2) to increase the resiliency of such sUAS supply chain using parts supplied by domestic sources and from allies and partners of the United States. <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H35D638A590FC496FB6FB65FECAD7B3FD" qb-display-quote="yes"> (b) Elements The measures carried out under subsection (a) shall include the following: <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HC60FF691EDEB45BEB46779816D891FAB" qb-display-quote="yes"> (1) Disassembly and analysis of commercially available foreign drone aircraft Not later than 90 days after the date of the enactment of this Act and not less frequently than once every three years thereafter until 2034, the Secretary of Defense shall fully disassemble a drone aircraft made by Da Jiang Innovations or a similar commercially available sUAS manufactured in a covered foreign country in order to— <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HAA286A5E3AF744758AEB1B47DAD41896" qb-display-quote="yes"> (A) create a taxonomy for each component that categorizes the component by function, level of risk, and such other criteria as the Secretary determines appropriate; and <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HAC8F5F35FFF34DAD891AF55EB984FE78" qb-display-quote="yes"> (B) help assess the risk of such components for the purposes of supply chain monitoring and visibility. <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HC17C49D17BEC42A2B1813E72092AF234" qb-display-quote="yes"> (2) Supply chain risk framework Not later than 150 days after the date of the enactment of this Act and using the taxonomy developed under paragraph (1)(A), the Secretary of Defense shall develop a supply chain risk framework in order to— <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H37302651966E4275A95BFA435F34A762" qb-display-quote="yes"> (A) assess the risk of each sUAS component to Department of Defense networks or operations; <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H94DFD2073FC849588C6222BD2100D2B8" qb-display-quote="yes"> (B) for components that present a risk as determined under subparagraph (A), identify any manufacturers of such components are based in covered foreign countries and evaluate whether measures to mitigate the risk posed by such foreign-produced components are feasible or practical; and <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HB9158B7C3D4B4BFC9DC9786F47D14623" qb-display-quote="yes"> (C) determine if any of the foreign companies in the sUAS supply chain should be included on the list maintained by the Department of Defense in accordance with section 1260H of the National Defense Authorization Act for Fiscal Year 2021 (Public Law 116–283; 10 U.S.C.

<subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H535991AFAF114B38B8F987DBC4FB1D7F" qb-display-quote="yes"> (i) Contract authority <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H24B1C21CC3C645D88129FFEBA27189B8" qb-display-quote="yes"> (1) In general The Secretary of the Army is authorized to enter into one or more contracts for the procurement of moving robotic target systems for use in the pilot program under subsection (a). <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H1E8DE2D7FEBC487DB6A9394C75A8ADA8" qb-display-quote="yes"> (2) Required capabilities Robotic target systems procured under paragraph (1) shall be capable of— <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HB3A39B1B216E467887CB3328E5EF1336" qb-display-quote="yes"> (A) conducting multiple realistic offensive and defensive scenarios in a single training session that are consistent with combat operations; <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H561612A8545A4FF68C3D8423A778FB4D" qb-display-quote="yes"> (B) operating in an unpredictable, realistic, and reactionary fashion; <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HA82DD9A3A2D84C3EAA0EDF57AC01FC26" qb-display-quote="yes"> (C) objectively scoring trainee performance; <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H6F8BBCD4869B43FC952854A0562A8305" qb-display-quote="yes"> (D) maneuvering across diverse geographic landscapes, including snow, ice, soft soils, extreme heat, extreme cold, wooded terrain and offroad areas; <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HE5DA150454F3463D83FAC32CCAFC6A9E" qb-display-quote="yes"> (E) operating at distances greater than 100 yards from the range operator; <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H139C344C105447B2AA5D76A10C4AD22D" qb-display-quote="yes"> (F) surviving live fire from 6.8 mm rounds and the Next Generation Squad Weapon of the Army; and <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H08238585AE004D5AA9E440956FFFD694" qb-display-quote="yes"> (G) fully functioning in all reasonably expected weather conditions. <section display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H94AC8F99A42E4916BB76F8DE07F57ED2" qb-display-quote="yes" section-type="subsequent-section"> 113.

<section display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H94AC8F99A42E4916BB76F8DE07F57ED2" qb-display-quote="yes" section-type="subsequent-section"> 113. PLAN FOR ADDITIONAL KINETIC EFFECTORS FOR LOW, SLOW, SMALL UNMANNED AIRCRAFT INTEGRATED DEFEAT SYSTEM OF THE ARMY <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H3199B95CE4394A36A1DFC501C904AA61" qb-display-quote="yes"> (a) Plan required The Secretary of the Army shall develop and implement a plan for the procurement and fielding of additional kinetic effectors for the low, slow, small unmanned aircraft integrated defeat system of the Army (FS–LIDS and M–LIDS). <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H1C8BDE3C43574D41AAA6631C39B46B0D" qb-display-quote="yes"> (b) Briefing Not later than September 30, 2025, the Secretary of the Army shall provide to the congressional defense committees a briefing on the plan developed under subsection (a).

<paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H8F878BDACF2F4F3F8052C17D482EC3B0" qb-display-quote="yes"> (3) An evaluation of the factors that the Army considers when procuring energetic materials from a source outside of the United States, including the production capacity for such materials at Federal Government-owned production facilities, the cost of materials, and the timelines associated with the production of end items. <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HF4778EBCFDB544678F25405F5C493BAC" qb-display-quote="yes"> (c) Definitions In this section: <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H3EE3A2EC865A4E53AAAC7474F96996E6" qb-display-quote="yes"> (1) The term <quote quote-display-end="auto" quote-display-start="auto" quote-type="text">end item has the meaning given that term in section 4863(m) of title 10, United States Code. <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H55D69598900646858B0879AF9077C7C9" qb-display-quote="yes"> (2) The term <quote quote-display-end="auto" quote-display-start="auto" quote-type="text">energetic materials means critical chemicals and formulations that— <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H8B34224617914064B5625910082F1DD6" qb-display-quote="yes"> (A) release large amounts of stored chemical energy; and <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HE652DF657FD4438ABAB6B0F8062BE3C3" qb-display-quote="yes"> (B) are capable of being used as explosives, propellants, pyrotechnics, and reactive materials that create lethal effects in warheads in kinetic weapons components and systems.

and inserting <quote quote-display-end="auto" quote-display-start="auto" quote-type="text"> CVN–81, and subsequent carriers ; <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HB8290B02DD1C47DB8A093003D99C07EA" qb-display-quote="yes"> (2) in paragraph (1) by striking <quote quote-display-end="auto" quote-display-start="auto" quote-type="text">and the CVN–81 and inserting <quote quote-display-end="auto" quote-display-start="auto" quote-type="text">the CVN–81, and each subsequent Ford-class aircraft carrier; and <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H806C4C9FD2C648BD8C06D3BF86A5F6AE" qb-display-quote="yes"> (B) by adding at the end the following new subparagraphs: <quoted-block display-end-quotes="yes" display-inline="no-display-inline" display-quotes="yes" id="HA79A47F1CA7A4A97BB6B5935299D4BF0" style="OLC"> <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HF59D3E993C1C4C67A9E09DCE3B4F76EE" qb-display-quote="yes"> (H) A comparison of the ship cost baseline to the most recent budget estimate available as of the date of the report, set forth separately for costs related to— <clause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H340DEC71C53742E6ADFBF2FDBA83360D" qb-display-quote="yes"> (i) development; <clause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H636E8DADA95D4B8DB16382659E348038" qb-display-quote="yes"> (ii) procurement; and <clause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HD76E3AC677664618A042F088F11221ED" qb-display-quote="yes"> (iii) operations and sustainment. <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H6A79DDF0DF384B9E8E6D48A3E57FB2D8" qb-display-quote="yes"> (I) For each contract that requires the production of a contract performance report, estimates from the contractor and program manager of— <clause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HC3BBD260052442748ACDF674B96075BA" qb-display-quote="yes"> (i) the total cost of the ship at completion, taking into account any changes in costs known or anticipated as of the date of the report; and <clause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H1013E673E0644B3ABFAE5DF0824B385D" qb-display-quote="yes"> (ii) the schedule for completion of the ship, taking into account any variances to such schedule known or anticipated as of the date of the report. ; and <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H3FB7B92B0D99494198E7D3B4931F73AE" qb-display-quote="yes"> (4) by adding at the end the following new paragraph: <quoted-block display-end-quotes="yes" display-inline="no-display-inline" display-quotes="yes" id="HC0915B68F95045B092A2C57C573B6F6B" style="OLC"> <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HD2097E254F5D42BFBDE42B344F83E063" qb-display-quote="yes"> (3) Commencement and termination of reporting The requirement to submit a report with respect to a Ford-class aircraft carrier under paragraph (1) shall— <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H74CC98FF55A34B9F9AC4C682F608F16A" qb-display-quote="yes"> (A) begin in the year following the first fiscal year for which funds are appropriated for the procurement of the carrier; and <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H202E04C6579C4BBD8B3046AF289230BB" qb-display-quote="yes"> (B) end on the date the carrier reaches its obligation work limiting date.

<subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H6A79DDF0DF384B9E8E6D48A3E57FB2D8" qb-display-quote="yes"> (I) For each contract that requires the production of a contract performance report, estimates from the contractor and program manager of— <clause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HC3BBD260052442748ACDF674B96075BA" qb-display-quote="yes"> (i) the total cost of the ship at completion, taking into account any changes in costs known or anticipated as of the date of the report; and <clause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H1013E673E0644B3ABFAE5DF0824B385D" qb-display-quote="yes"> (ii) the schedule for completion of the ship, taking into account any variances to such schedule known or anticipated as of the date of the report. ; and <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H3FB7B92B0D99494198E7D3B4931F73AE" qb-display-quote="yes"> (4) by adding at the end the following new paragraph: <quoted-block display-end-quotes="yes" display-inline="no-display-inline" display-quotes="yes" id="HC0915B68F95045B092A2C57C573B6F6B" style="OLC"> <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HD2097E254F5D42BFBDE42B344F83E063" qb-display-quote="yes"> (3) Commencement and termination of reporting The requirement to submit a report with respect to a Ford-class aircraft carrier under paragraph (1) shall— <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H74CC98FF55A34B9F9AC4C682F608F16A" qb-display-quote="yes"> (A) begin in the year following the first fiscal year for which funds are appropriated for the procurement of the carrier; and <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H202E04C6579C4BBD8B3046AF289230BB" qb-display-quote="yes"> (B) end on the date the carrier reaches its obligation work limiting date. .

<section display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H205B9A22A7ED4C4D99680BA90FFFDA3F" qb-display-quote="yes" section-type="subsequent-section"> 130. LIMITATION ON STRUCTURAL IMPROVEMENTS AND ELECTRICAL POWER UPGRADES FOR AH–1Z AND UH–1Y HELICOPTERS <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H61113AF53E9748CD9A720B1F3FB81E3F" qb-display-quote="yes"> (a) Limitation The Secretary of the Navy may not carry out covered upgrades to AH–1Z Viper and UH–1Y Venom helicopters at a location other than a facility owned by the original equipment manufacturer for such helicopters until the date on which the Secretary certifies to the Committees on Armed Services of the Senate and the House of Representatives that the plan for carrying out covered upgrades at location other than a facility owned by the original equipment manufacturer is expected— <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H0ACF379DCAF64500AA2F2419DCB7459B" qb-display-quote="yes"> (1) to result in levels of performance, survivability, lethality, interoperability, mission execution, and overall safety of the helicopter platform that match or exceed the levels that would otherwise be achievable by completing such upgrades at a facility owned by the original equipment manufacturer for the model of helicopter involved; <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H379594F86E0148E2BB9D65A56A8E20A7" qb-display-quote="yes"> (2) to provide improved onboard electrical power capacity and ensure adequate power margin for integrating future capabilities; <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H06661D0A10C44EB6A4AE7F35295780F3" qb-display-quote="yes"> (3) to improve and expand future weapons interfaces; and <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HBB50403A03CA4B28BD0CFC6C6EA55F46" qb-display-quote="yes"> (4) to allow for improved ease of maintenance. <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H39369D8C706347A3B38EB7626F4D2527" qb-display-quote="yes"> (b) Covered upgrades In this section, the term <quote quote-display-end="auto" quote-display-start="auto" quote-type="text">covered upgrades means any structural improvements or electrical power upgrades for AH–1Z Viper or UH–1Y Venom helicopters.

PLAN FOR ESTABLISHMENT AND MAINTENANCE OF F–16 SIMULATORS AT AIR NATIONAL GUARD TRAINING CENTERS <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HFFE85CACAD7C417D977DD7C93B38DA31" qb-display-quote="yes"> (a) In general The Secretary of the Air Force, in coordination with the Director of the Air National Guard, shall develop a plan to fully fund the establishment and maintenance of F–16 simulators at training centers of the Air National Guard as described in subsection (b). <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H3849279A8069460292825DB5FB576FF3" qb-display-quote="yes"> (b) Elements The plan under subsection (a) shall include— <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H70ACE597ECB24C13929A23E30A8D5977" qb-display-quote="yes"> (1) an estimate of the costs of maintaining F–16 simulators at Air National Guard training centers that have such simulators as of the date of the plan; <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H959604FC08C64E4CB191EC8A7279109F" qb-display-quote="yes"> (2) an estimate of the costs of establishing F–16 simulators at all Air National Guard training centers that are required to, but do not, have such simulators as of the date of the plan, including training centers for Air National Guard units converting from the A–10 aircraft to the F–16 aircraft; and <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H3A657EFE76E04E2EA24E40F4F3EC63A6" qb-display-quote="yes"> (3) a plan for allocating funding to pay the costs described in paragraphs (1) and (2), including the proportion of such funding expected to be provided by the Air Force and the Air National Guard, respectively. <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HE53B1C67F2A240439A1561252AABE92E" qb-display-quote="yes"> (c) Report Not later than March 1, 2025, the Secretary of the Air Force shall submit to the congressional defense committees a report that includes— <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H83D548293AC54B2EA26543FC367557DA" qb-display-quote="yes"> (1) the plan developed under subsection (a); and <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HEBA75942A9B94E0CAC32DBABB958DCA0" qb-display-quote="yes"> (2) an assessment from the Secretary and the Chief of the National Guard Bureau evaluating how the readiness of Air National Guard Units requiring F–16 simulators may be affected if such simulators are not established and maintained at mission training centers as proposed under the plan.

<section display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H0794D4A712284F4CA17416A050640BD0" qb-display-quote="yes" section-type="subsequent-section"> 163. POLICY ON QUALIFICATIONS OF CONTRACTORS FOR INTO-PLANE FUEL DELIVERIES FOR HEAVY-LIFT AIRCRAFT <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H3E88A576A5F0421496B511208D176BFE" qb-display-quote="yes"> (a) Establishment of policy Not later than one year after the date of the enactment of this Act, the Director of the Defense Logistics Agency shall develop and implement a policy pursuant to which acquisition planning shall be performed for any contract providing for the into-plane procurement for heavy-lift aircraft of an estimated 5,000,000 gallons or more of aviation fuel per year within the continental United States. <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H9F86291000F249A788345824E01F1EB1" qb-display-quote="yes"> (b) Use of evaluation factors As part of the acquisition planning required under subsection (a), the Director of the Defense Logistics Agency shall determine whether to use evaluation factors to assess the qualifications of fixed-based operators bidding on contracts described in such subsection.

<paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H6030FFFC70B8481E81A8314A1456F792" qb-display-quote="yes"> (5) Any other factors the Director determines appropriate. <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HBC20551DF836463C8886585667CB6CC0" qb-display-quote="yes"> (c) Consultation The Director of the Defense Logistics Agency shall, as appropriate, consult with appropriate personnel of the military departments in developing mission requirements at commercial airports for purposes of the acquisition planning required under subsection (a). <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H811A81CE6A714D609F5E9F032838AC01" qb-display-quote="yes"> (d) Heavy-lift aircraft defined In this section, the term <quote quote-display-end="auto" quote-display-start="auto" quote-type="text">heavy-lift aircraft means an aircraft with a maximum gross takeoff weight in excess of 107,000 pounds.

<subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HFA6AF51E24434764A703A70F1F741954" qb-display-quote="yes"> (d) Effective date The prohibition under section (a) shall take effect on June 30, 2026. <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H07FC89C3C01B47B8BCBC831F1410C5AF" qb-display-quote="yes"> (e) Definitions In this section: <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HAC1BD44D676E43AE9FFEC90905B7402F" qb-display-quote="yes"> (1) The term <quote quote-display-end="auto" quote-display-start="auto" quote-type="text">covered foreign country means any of the following: <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HB3791D3B0CC647DCA1667D05F63D915B" qb-display-quote="yes"> (A) The People’s Republic of China. <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H3D22B305E0E84226BB828A1E1D9CDEE9" qb-display-quote="yes"> (B) The Islamic Republic of Iran.

2448) is amended— <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H80A093FBA2B84A1E9660486104928BA7" qb-display-quote="yes"> (1) in subsection (c)— <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H4F626E5AD7714564B9318525CC4A4AAD" qb-display-quote="yes"> (A) in the subsection heading, by inserting <quote quote-display-end="auto" quote-display-start="auto" quote-type="text"> across programs after <quote quote-display-end="auto" quote-display-start="auto" quote-type="text"> advance procurement ; and <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H48D06895DF9E49BEB67354A3E3A22B5A" qb-display-quote="yes"> (B) by inserting <quote quote-display-end="auto" quote-display-start="auto" quote-type="text">across programs after <quote quote-display-end="auto" quote-display-start="auto" quote-type="text">advance procurement; <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HC5B49EA23D77466D8624755BFFCB2F18" qb-display-quote="yes"> (2) by redesignating subsections (d), (e), and (f) as subsections (e), (f), and (g), respectively; and <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HE4C0392772354DF180EF3145CA774C3D" qb-display-quote="yes"> (3) by inserting after subsection (c) the following new subsection: <quoted-block display-end-quotes="yes" display-inline="no-display-inline" display-quotes="yes" id="H65ACD013C3894A24A6C84DD8A4FBBFFB" style="OLC"> <section display-inline="no-display-inline" id="d1e4155" qb-display-quote="yes" section-type="subsequent-section"> <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H2B60D94A90CA468484F884665476B478" qb-display-quote="yes"> (d) Authority to enter into economic order quantity contracts The Secretary of the Navy may use funds made available to carry out this section to enter into contracts known as <quote quote-display-end="auto" quote-display-start="auto" quote-type="text">economic order quantity contracts with private shipyards and other commercial or government entities to achieve economic efficiencies based on production economies for major components or subsystems of covered ships. The authority under this subsection extends to the procurement of parts, components, and systems (including weapon systems) common with, and required for, covered ships under joint economic order quantity contracts. .

RECAPITALIZATION OF AIR REFUELING TANKER AIRCRAFT OF THE RESERVE COMPONENTS OF THE AIR FORCE <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HC9F4578B65B0465A989BE1329CF05CBC" qb-display-quote="yes"> (a) In general The Secretary of the Air Force shall replace covered reserve KC–135 aircraft on a one-for-one basis with air refueling tanker aircraft that have capabilities equivalent to or exceeding the capabilities of the aircraft being replaced. <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H90B58F86DCBB4615AB231E676F3624B5" qb-display-quote="yes"> (b) Additional requirements In carrying out subsection (a), the Secretary of the Air Force— <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H578B01BBE59C4403AC8E8BC529182D35" qb-display-quote="yes"> (1) may not take any action that would reduce the inventory of air refueling tanker aircraft assigned to a reserve component below the levels set forth in the budget of the President for fiscal year 2025 (as submitted to Congress under section 1105(a) of title 31, United States Code); and <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HED7DE57B47C84351B09F7D5DBFB54B80" qb-display-quote="yes"> (2) shall ensure that, in the event a reserve component unit is assigned a greater number of KC–135 aircraft than are being replaced with a KC–46 or later-generation air refueling tanker aircraft, any KC–135 aircraft remaining after such replacement will remain within the reserve component for redistribution within that component. <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HF84EF12943774985A831D3CD6D8ECB36" qb-display-quote="yes"> (c) Waiver The Secretary of the Air Force may waive the requirement to replace an air refueling tanker aircraft under subsection (a), on a case by case basis, if the Secretary determines that such replacement would degrade the readiness of the air refueling capability of the Air Force.

RECAPITALIZATION OF AIR REFUELING TANKER AIRCRAFT OF THE RESERVE COMPONENTS OF THE AIR FORCE <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HC9F4578B65B0465A989BE1329CF05CBC" qb-display-quote="yes"> (a) In general The Secretary of the Air Force shall replace covered reserve KC–135 aircraft on a one-for-one basis with air refueling tanker aircraft that have capabilities equivalent to or exceeding the capabilities of the aircraft being replaced. <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H90B58F86DCBB4615AB231E676F3624B5" qb-display-quote="yes"> (b) Additional requirements In carrying out subsection (a), the Secretary of the Air Force— <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H578B01BBE59C4403AC8E8BC529182D35" qb-display-quote="yes"> (1) may not take any action that would reduce the inventory of air refueling tanker aircraft assigned to a reserve component below the levels set forth in the budget of the President for fiscal year 2025 (as submitted to Congress under section 1105(a) of title 31, United States Code); and <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HED7DE57B47C84351B09F7D5DBFB54B80" qb-display-quote="yes"> (2) shall ensure that, in the event a reserve component unit is assigned a greater number of KC–135 aircraft than are being replaced with a KC–46 or later-generation air refueling tanker aircraft, any KC–135 aircraft remaining after such replacement will remain within the reserve component for redistribution within that component. <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HF84EF12943774985A831D3CD6D8ECB36" qb-display-quote="yes"> (c) Waiver The Secretary of the Air Force may waive the requirement to replace an air refueling tanker aircraft under subsection (a), on a case by case basis, if the Secretary determines that such replacement would degrade the readiness of the air refueling capability of the Air Force.

PLAN AND REQUIREMENTS FOR FIELDING AIR BASE AIR DEFENSE SITES AT AIR FORCE INSTALLATIONS <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HB048033864DA4AECAFBCA5A586BFFD38" qb-display-quote="yes"> (a) Plan required The Secretary of the Air Force, in consultation with the Commander of the United States Northern Command, the Commander of United States European Command, and the Commander of United States Indo-Pacific Command, shall develop and implement a plan to support the fielding of air base air defense sites at Air Force installations and other priority sites identified by the Secretary. <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HF36ADA59B28240AFA59C16E59F078074" qb-display-quote="yes"> (b) Air base air defense site requirements Each air base air defense site fielded under the plan required under subsection (a) shall have the following capabilities: <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H3E778168B26B4541A3120D7E78AD607A" qb-display-quote="yes"> (1) Expeditionary mobile protection for dispersed air bases. <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H4558D055A0D74758B486107C512E2D19" qb-display-quote="yes"> (2) Fixed protection for primary air bases.

<paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H7D4FEEB642B141C08149766A41627D2B" qb-display-quote="yes"> (2) Form The report required under paragraph (1) shall be submitted in unclassified form, but may contain a classified annex. <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H5640D974C9F2469C80A4C1E6E9E454B7" qb-display-quote="yes"> (d) Definitions In this section: <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HFF14D63CC2A04E248CDCD16903045DFE" qb-display-quote="yes"> (1) The term <quote quote-display-end="auto" quote-display-start="auto" quote-type="text">advanced capability fighter aircraft— <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HDCE95573E3E541E6BE1333E0A7F2837E" qb-display-quote="yes"> (A) means the next-generation air dominance fighter aircraft or any other fighter aircraft referenced or designated as a sixth generation airframe; and <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H8D03768CD75E4D5DA014DB8EE83B37AD" qb-display-quote="yes"> (B) does not include unmanned fighter aircraft. <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HC81AF051E2CD4B6B93ACBD4EC0D3C351" qb-display-quote="yes"> (2) The term <quote quote-display-end="auto" quote-display-start="auto" quote-type="text">fifth generation, with respect to fighter aircraft, means an F–22 or F–35 aircraft.

<subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H35D638A590FC496FB6FB65FECAD7B3FD" qb-display-quote="yes"> (b) Elements The measures carried out under subsection (a) shall include the following: <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HC60FF691EDEB45BEB46779816D891FAB" qb-display-quote="yes"> (1) Disassembly and analysis of commercially available foreign drone aircraft Not later than 90 days after the date of the enactment of this Act and not less frequently than once every three years thereafter until 2034, the Secretary of Defense shall fully disassemble a drone aircraft made by Da Jiang Innovations or a similar commercially available sUAS manufactured in a covered foreign country in order to— <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HAA286A5E3AF744758AEB1B47DAD41896" qb-display-quote="yes"> (A) create a taxonomy for each component that categorizes the component by function, level of risk, and such other criteria as the Secretary determines appropriate; and <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HAC8F5F35FFF34DAD891AF55EB984FE78" qb-display-quote="yes"> (B) help assess the risk of such components for the purposes of supply chain monitoring and visibility. <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HC17C49D17BEC42A2B1813E72092AF234" qb-display-quote="yes"> (2) Supply chain risk framework Not later than 150 days after the date of the enactment of this Act and using the taxonomy developed under paragraph (1)(A), the Secretary of Defense shall develop a supply chain risk framework in order to— <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H37302651966E4275A95BFA435F34A762" qb-display-quote="yes"> (A) assess the risk of each sUAS component to Department of Defense networks or operations; <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H94DFD2073FC849588C6222BD2100D2B8" qb-display-quote="yes"> (B) for components that present a risk as determined under subparagraph (A), identify any manufacturers of such components are based in covered foreign countries and evaluate whether measures to mitigate the risk posed by such foreign-produced components are feasible or practical; and <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HB9158B7C3D4B4BFC9DC9786F47D14623" qb-display-quote="yes"> (C) determine if any of the foreign companies in the sUAS supply chain should be included on the list maintained by the Department of Defense in accordance with section 1260H of the National Defense Authorization Act for Fiscal Year 2021 (Public Law 116–283; 10 U.S.C. 113 note).

<subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H35D638A590FC496FB6FB65FECAD7B3FD" qb-display-quote="yes"> (b) Elements The measures carried out under subsection (a) shall include the following: <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HC60FF691EDEB45BEB46779816D891FAB" qb-display-quote="yes"> (1) Disassembly and analysis of commercially available foreign drone aircraft Not later than 90 days after the date of the enactment of this Act and not less frequently than once every three years thereafter until 2034, the Secretary of Defense shall fully disassemble a drone aircraft made by Da Jiang Innovations or a similar commercially available sUAS manufactured in a covered foreign country in order to— <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HAA286A5E3AF744758AEB1B47DAD41896" qb-display-quote="yes"> (A) create a taxonomy for each component that categorizes the component by function, level of risk, and such other criteria as the Secretary determines appropriate; and <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HAC8F5F35FFF34DAD891AF55EB984FE78" qb-display-quote="yes"> (B) help assess the risk of such components for the purposes of supply chain monitoring and visibility. <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HC17C49D17BEC42A2B1813E72092AF234" qb-display-quote="yes"> (2) Supply chain risk framework Not later than 150 days after the date of the enactment of this Act and using the taxonomy developed under paragraph (1)(A), the Secretary of Defense shall develop a supply chain risk framework in order to— <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H37302651966E4275A95BFA435F34A762" qb-display-quote="yes"> (A) assess the risk of each sUAS component to Department of Defense networks or operations; <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H94DFD2073FC849588C6222BD2100D2B8" qb-display-quote="yes"> (B) for components that present a risk as determined under subparagraph (A), identify any manufacturers of such components are based in covered foreign countries and evaluate whether measures to mitigate the risk posed by such foreign-produced components are feasible or practical; and <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HB9158B7C3D4B4BFC9DC9786F47D14623" qb-display-quote="yes"> (C) determine if any of the foreign companies in the sUAS supply chain should be included on the list maintained by the Department of Defense in accordance with section 1260H of the National Defense Authorization Act for Fiscal Year 2021 (Public Law 116–283; 10 U.S.C. 113 note).

<paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H6030FFFC70B8481E81A8314A1456F792" qb-display-quote="yes"> (5) Any other factors the Director determines appropriate. <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HBC20551DF836463C8886585667CB6CC0" qb-display-quote="yes"> (c) Consultation The Director of the Defense Logistics Agency shall, as appropriate, consult with appropriate personnel of the military departments in developing mission requirements at commercial airports for purposes of the acquisition planning required under subsection (a). <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H811A81CE6A714D609F5E9F032838AC01" qb-display-quote="yes"> (d) Heavy-lift aircraft defined In this section, the term <quote quote-display-end="auto" quote-display-start="auto" quote-type="text">heavy-lift aircraft means an aircraft with a maximum gross takeoff weight in excess of 107,000 pounds.

<section display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H02B578EC2B344DA3AD065AC9C74814EC" qb-display-quote="yes" section-type="subsequent-section"> 164. PROHIBITION ON OPERATION, PROCUREMENT, AND CONTRACTING RELATED TO FOREIGN-MADE LIGHT DETECTION AND RANGING TECHNOLOGY <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H7DC1705D12E24F768424E974D4F27A7D" qb-display-quote="yes"> (a) Prohibition on agency operation or procurement The Secretary of Defense shall not operate or enter into or renew a contract for the procurement of— <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H140D0C71365E4686AB2B8133BD3FEED3" qb-display-quote="yes"> (1) a covered light detection and ranging technology (referred to in this section as <quote quote-display-end="auto" quote-display-start="auto" quote-type="text">LiDAR technology) that— <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HD00A6C7E837940FABED5D1AB8D7BB76F" qb-display-quote="yes"> (A) is manufactured in a covered foreign country or by an entity domiciled in a covered foreign country; <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HF4F9055635024C7082B381173A68107C" qb-display-quote="yes"> (B) uses operating software developed in a covered foreign country or by an entity domiciled in a covered foreign country; or <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H8D6609D26F6D45CA98B7D25BC0AC6EB6" qb-display-quote="yes"> (C) uses network connectivity or data storage located in or administered by an entity domiciled in a covered foreign country; or <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HE8234CE710204EF99257013E21F8B4F0" qb-display-quote="yes"> (2) a system or systems that incorporates, interfaces with, or otherwise uses LiDAR technology as described in paragraph (1). <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H9EF976202BAA4321AF9185EAEACACCA6" qb-display-quote="yes"> (b) Exemption The prohibition under subsection (a) shall not apply if the operation, procurement, or contracting action is for the purposes of intelligence, electronic warfare, and information warfare operations, testing, analysis, and training.

Inhofe National Defense Authorization Act for Fiscal Year 2023 (Public Law 117–263; 136 Stat. 2448) is amended— <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H80A093FBA2B84A1E9660486104928BA7" qb-display-quote="yes"> (1) in subsection (c)— <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H4F626E5AD7714564B9318525CC4A4AAD" qb-display-quote="yes"> (A) in the subsection heading, by inserting <quote quote-display-end="auto" quote-display-start="auto" quote-type="text"> across programs after <quote quote-display-end="auto" quote-display-start="auto" quote-type="text"> advance procurement ; and <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H48D06895DF9E49BEB67354A3E3A22B5A" qb-display-quote="yes"> (B) by inserting <quote quote-display-end="auto" quote-display-start="auto" quote-type="text">across programs after <quote quote-display-end="auto" quote-display-start="auto" quote-type="text">advance procurement; <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HC5B49EA23D77466D8624755BFFCB2F18" qb-display-quote="yes"> (2) by redesignating subsections (d), (e), and (f) as subsections (e), (f), and (g), respectively; and <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HE4C0392772354DF180EF3145CA774C3D" qb-display-quote="yes"> (3) by inserting after subsection (c) the following new subsection: <quoted-block display-end-quotes="yes" display-inline="no-display-inline" display-quotes="yes" id="H65ACD013C3894A24A6C84DD8A4FBBFFB" style="OLC"> <section display-inline="no-display-inline" id="d1e4155" qb-display-quote="yes" section-type="subsequent-section"> <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H2B60D94A90CA468484F884665476B478" qb-display-quote="yes"> (d) Authority to enter into economic order quantity contracts The Secretary of the Navy may use funds made available to carry out this section to enter into contracts known as <quote quote-display-end="auto" quote-display-start="auto" quote-type="text">economic order quantity contracts with private shipyards and other commercial or government entities to achieve economic efficiencies based on production economies for major components or subsystems of covered ships. The authority under this subsection extends to the procurement of parts, components, and systems (including weapon systems) common with, and required for, covered ships under joint economic order quantity contracts.

<subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H6A79DDF0DF384B9E8E6D48A3E57FB2D8" qb-display-quote="yes"> (I) For each contract that requires the production of a contract performance report, estimates from the contractor and program manager of— <clause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HC3BBD260052442748ACDF674B96075BA" qb-display-quote="yes"> (i) the total cost of the ship at completion, taking into account any changes in costs known or anticipated as of the date of the report; and <clause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H1013E673E0644B3ABFAE5DF0824B385D" qb-display-quote="yes"> (ii) the schedule for completion of the ship, taking into account any variances to such schedule known or anticipated as of the date of the report. ; and <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H3FB7B92B0D99494198E7D3B4931F73AE" qb-display-quote="yes"> (4) by adding at the end the following new paragraph: <quoted-block display-end-quotes="yes" display-inline="no-display-inline" display-quotes="yes" id="HC0915B68F95045B092A2C57C573B6F6B" style="OLC"> <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HD2097E254F5D42BFBDE42B344F83E063" qb-display-quote="yes"> (3) Commencement and termination of reporting The requirement to submit a report with respect to a Ford-class aircraft carrier under paragraph (1) shall— <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H74CC98FF55A34B9F9AC4C682F608F16A" qb-display-quote="yes"> (A) begin in the year following the first fiscal year for which funds are appropriated for the procurement of the carrier; and <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H202E04C6579C4BBD8B3046AF289230BB" qb-display-quote="yes"> (B) end on the date the carrier reaches its obligation work limiting date. .

DESIGNATION OF OFFICIAL RESPONSIBLE FOR AUTONOMOUS SURFACE AND UNDERWATER DUAL-MODALITY VEHICLES <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H9425E3124958498DA6CE7251554BC5F4" qb-display-quote="yes"> (a) Designation required Not later than 180 days after the date of the enactment of this Act, the Secretary of the Navy shall designate an appropriate official within the Department of the Navy to have primary responsibility for the development and acquisition of surface and underwater dual-modality, advanced autonomous vehicles, consistent with warfighter requirements. <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H97AC07A779F947BCBCB61CF140A16451" qb-display-quote="yes"> (b) Program element The Secretary of the Navy shall ensure, within budget program elements for the Navy, that there is a dedicated program element for the development and acquisition of surface and underwater dual-modality, advanced autonomous vehicles. <section display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HB1E72B10C9BA46E3971CCCCE80542359" qb-display-quote="yes" section-type="subsequent-section"> 126.

RECAPITALIZATION OF AIR REFUELING TANKER AIRCRAFT OF THE RESERVE COMPONENTS OF THE AIR FORCE <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HC9F4578B65B0465A989BE1329CF05CBC" qb-display-quote="yes"> (a) In general The Secretary of the Air Force shall replace covered reserve KC–135 aircraft on a one-for-one basis with air refueling tanker aircraft that have capabilities equivalent to or exceeding the capabilities of the aircraft being replaced.

PLAN FOR SUSTAINMENT AND RECAPITALIZATION OF AIR NATIONAL GUARD FIGHTER FLEET <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HEF1A775C3F644537B87D9E411C77DCA6" qb-display-quote="yes"> (a) In general The Secretary of the Air Force, in consultation with the Director of the Air National Guard, shall develop a plan to sustain and recapitalize the fighter fleet of the Air National Guard. <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HD5440D431C7B499D9652A3F510570257" qb-display-quote="yes"> (b) Elements The recapitalization plan required under subsection (a) shall— <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H1A45BFCA30954E8293C9BBA308A4879F" qb-display-quote="yes"> (1) identify each of the 25 fighter aircraft squadrons of the Air National Guard in existence on the date of the enactment of this Act; <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H6C177133542F434E937F67EB938537A4" qb-display-quote="yes"> (2) provide a plan for recapitalization of all such squadrons at a similar rate as the fighter aircraft squadrons of the active components of the Armed Forces, with the same combination of legacy capability fighter aircraft and advanced capability fighter aircraft found in fighter aircraft squadrons of the active components of the Armed Forces; <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H3BE19FD1DDD241A3A7102EF4EA15AA61" qb-display-quote="yes"> (3) establish a timetable for a plan or actions for the recapitalization proposed under paragraph (2), disaggregated by fighter aircraft squadron and fiscal year, which shall identify funding required for each fiscal year; <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H1ABB7655DBAF4905915533C4C7AFBA60" qb-display-quote="yes"> (4) assess budgetary effects on the active components of the Armed Forces if the recapitalization plan proposed under paragraph (2) were implemented in accordance with the timeline established in paragraph (3); and <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H7A1C045C10864B0381989C7A7A32F04D" qb-display-quote="yes"> (5) assess the effects of such plan on the operational readiness and personnel readiness of the active and reserve components of the Armed Forces, including the effects of such plan on the ability of such components to meet steady state and contingency force presentation and mission requirements of combatant commanders. <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H51DC424233AC4026B5B1139FBF3643C7" qb-display-quote="yes"> (c) Report <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H140F6D22495844CFAA30845AA699D3F4" qb-display-quote="yes"> (1) In general Not later than July 1, 2025, the Secretary of the Air Force shall submit to the congressional defense committees a report that includes the sustainment and recapitalization plan required under subsection (a).

<paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H9989C64E7E3E4D78B680408B279C64C4" qb-display-quote="yes"> (4) Whether the fixed-based operator has acceptable past performance history on similar procurements. <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H6030FFFC70B8481E81A8314A1456F792" qb-display-quote="yes"> (5) Any other factors the Director determines appropriate. <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HBC20551DF836463C8886585667CB6CC0" qb-display-quote="yes"> (c) Consultation The Director of the Defense Logistics Agency shall, as appropriate, consult with appropriate personnel of the military departments in developing mission requirements at commercial airports for purposes of the acquisition planning required under subsection (a).

<subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H9956A941E914466184A5756432265D82" qb-display-quote="yes"> (g) Termination The pilot program under subsection (a) shall terminate five years after the date of the enactment of this Act. <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H94FE8A19C35A4F18A241AF04DC641D0C" qb-display-quote="yes"> (h) Briefings Not later than 90 days after concluding activities under the pilot program at a military installation selected under subsection (c), the Secretary of the Army shall provide to the Committees on Armed Services of the Senate and the House of Representatives a briefing that includes a description of— <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H756B7D936EC447D0B2F5FB14306E019A" qb-display-quote="yes"> (1) the manner in which the program was conducted at such installation; and <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H057BC9B38F1C41D8909199C02CCE76A0" qb-display-quote="yes"> (2) any results achieved under the program at such installation. <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H535991AFAF114B38B8F987DBC4FB1D7F" qb-display-quote="yes"> (i) Contract authority <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H24B1C21CC3C645D88129FFEBA27189B8" qb-display-quote="yes"> (1) In general The Secretary of the Army is authorized to enter into one or more contracts for the procurement of moving robotic target systems for use in the pilot program under subsection (a).

Inhofe National Defense Authorization Act for Fiscal Year 2023 (Public Law 117–263; 136 Stat. 2455), as amended by section 134(a) of the National Defense Authorization Act for Fiscal Year 2024 (Public Law 118–31; 137 Stat.

NOTIFICATION OF DELAYS IN DELIVERY OF MH–139 AIRCRAFT <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H7BC5C92910D946DBB96F7EBDB54EBA81" qb-display-quote="yes"> (a) Notice required Not later than 30 days after becoming aware of an expected delay in the delivery date of an MH–139 aircraft, the Secretary of the Air Force shall submit to the Committees on Armed Services of the Senate and the House of Representatives written notice of such delay together with an explanation of the reasons for such delay. <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H9FDA2DE3637A45CCB64C5C844EDCE400" qb-display-quote="yes"> (b) Delivery date defined In this section, the term <quote quote-display-end="auto" quote-display-start="auto" quote-type="text">delivery date, when used with respect to an MH–139 aircraft, means the date on which such aircraft is expected to be delivered to the Air Force under the most recent schedule for such delivery in effect as of the date of the enactment of this Act. <section display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HF6C1E20C8FC24B6F9EC7FBC2A2C41663" qb-display-quote="yes" section-type="subsequent-section"> 152.

PLAN FOR ESTABLISHMENT AND MAINTENANCE OF F–16 SIMULATORS AT AIR NATIONAL GUARD TRAINING CENTERS <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HFFE85CACAD7C417D977DD7C93B38DA31" qb-display-quote="yes"> (a) In general The Secretary of the Air Force, in coordination with the Director of the Air National Guard, shall develop a plan to fully fund the establishment and maintenance of F–16 simulators at training centers of the Air National Guard as described in subsection (b). <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H3849279A8069460292825DB5FB576FF3" qb-display-quote="yes"> (b) Elements The plan under subsection (a) shall include— <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H70ACE597ECB24C13929A23E30A8D5977" qb-display-quote="yes"> (1) an estimate of the costs of maintaining F–16 simulators at Air National Guard training centers that have such simulators as of the date of the plan; <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H959604FC08C64E4CB191EC8A7279109F" qb-display-quote="yes"> (2) an estimate of the costs of establishing F–16 simulators at all Air National Guard training centers that are required to, but do not, have such simulators as of the date of the plan, including training centers for Air National Guard units converting from the A–10 aircraft to the F–16 aircraft; and <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H3A657EFE76E04E2EA24E40F4F3EC63A6" qb-display-quote="yes"> (3) a plan for allocating funding to pay the costs described in paragraphs (1) and (2), including the proportion of such funding expected to be provided by the Air Force and the Air National Guard, respectively. <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HE53B1C67F2A240439A1561252AABE92E" qb-display-quote="yes"> (c) Report Not later than March 1, 2025, the Secretary of the Air Force shall submit to the congressional defense committees a report that includes— <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H83D548293AC54B2EA26543FC367557DA" qb-display-quote="yes"> (1) the plan developed under subsection (a); and <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HEBA75942A9B94E0CAC32DBABB958DCA0" qb-display-quote="yes"> (2) an assessment from the Secretary and the Chief of the National Guard Bureau evaluating how the readiness of Air National Guard Units requiring F–16 simulators may be affected if such simulators are not established and maintained at mission training centers as proposed under the plan.

<paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HF9631E1727CA4EB49D1969F6D14D1409" qb-display-quote="yes"> (4) The term <quote quote-display-end="auto" quote-display-start="auto" quote-type="text">legacy capability fighter aircraft means pre-fifth generation fighter aircraft, including an F–16, both pre-block and post-block, F–15C/D, F–15E/EX, and A–10. <subtitle id="H21DABED7243B449FB02A8C4DC5894997" qb-display-quote="yes" style="OLC"> E Defense-wide, Joint, and Multiservice Matters <section display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HC4E493FF197A4C1EB3D0F0EF35E6FD29" qb-display-quote="yes" section-type="subsequent-section"> 161.
