MEASURES TO INCREASE SUPPLY CHAIN RESILIENCY FOR SMALL UNMANNED AERIAL SYSTEMS <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HC9AAA68BA5724529A893711DC3462817" qb-display-quote="yes"> (a) In general Not later than 180 days after the date of the enactment of this Act, the Secretary of Defense shall establish and carry out an integrated set of measures— <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H7EFE56E23BBA43ECA50E8BB549DD323A" qb-display-quote="yes"> (1) to identify risks in the supply chain for small unmanned aerial systems (referred to in this section as <quote quote-display-end="auto" quote-display-start="auto" quote-type="text">sUAS); and <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H0FD9724C6EAE4C58924BBB83B7DDEA67" qb-display-quote="yes"> (2) to increase the resiliency of such sUAS supply chain using parts supplied by domestic sources and from allies and partners of the United States.

<section display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H67A4D6B105A9414E850ABC008AF68534" qb-display-quote="yes" section-type="subsequent-section"> 5. JOINT EXPLANATORY STATEMENT The joint explanatory statement regarding this Act, printed in the House section of the Congressional Record on or about December 11, 2024, by the Chairman of the Committee on Armed Services of the House of Representatives and the Chairman of the Committee on Armed Services of the Senate, shall have the same effect with respect to the implementation of this Act as if it were a joint explanatory statement of a committee of conference. A DEPARTMENT OF DEFENSE AUTHORIZATIONS <title id="HF01CE0D872CE4D78B891C3404FAB8D29" qb-display-quote="yes" style="OLC"> I PROCUREMENT <toc container-level="title-container" lowest-level="section" quoted-block="no-quoted-block" regeneration="no-regeneration"> <toc-entry align="left" bold="off" idref="H0D6EB03E02F74557BC873FDE9F2CB1B2" level="subtitle">Subtitle A—Authorization of Appropriations <toc-entry align="left" bold="off" idref="HF198EA31D7DA48B39EC4D96ED8512711" level="section">Sec.

<subtitle id="H025B6ACD7BA64CB7BC670C3EA7C7BDDA" qb-display-quote="yes" style="OLC"> B Army Programs <section display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HF5748EC195C84CC9ABA4B3751FEC2B3F" qb-display-quote="yes" section-type="subsequent-section"> 111. CENTRALIZED SECURITY MONITORING PROGRAM FOR FACILITIES OF THE ARMY <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H5770747E693444F7B7D6F334D390EF7F" qb-display-quote="yes"> (a) In general The Secretary of the Army, in coordination with the heads of relevant organizations of the Department of Defense and other departments and agencies of the Federal Government, shall develop a plan for the implementation of a Centralized Security Monitoring Program (referred to in this section as the <quote quote-display-end="auto" quote-display-start="auto" quote-type="text">Program) for installations and facilities of the Department of the Army within the United States. <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H778C910944B443EB8A9C8126BD24BB4A" qb-display-quote="yes"> (b) Elements The plan required by subsection (a) shall include the following: <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H5CE78934C7554A28A9D2E6BC4892B249" qb-display-quote="yes"> (1) Proposed security solution A proposal for the development and implementation of a cost-effective, scalable solution to modernize and centralize security operations across Army facilities in the United States with full consideration given to minimizing operational impacts while maximizing technological advantages for enhanced security.

These locations shall— <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H16A2440EEB6B49998CB7E93C7E2160C6" qb-display-quote="yes"> (A) serve as the primary hubs for the continuous monitoring of installation security across all installations of the Department of the Army in the United States; <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H4E26FAB0C5FA408A9ED3CB2B31B28452" qb-display-quote="yes"> (B) represent a mix of large and extra-large facilities, as defined by the 2016 business case analysis conducted by the Provost Marshal General of the Army; and <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HAF80BFC23FE6463D9D031A3CD38530A4" qb-display-quote="yes"> (C) be chosen based on geographical diversity and their strategic importance to the Army’s overall security infrastructure. <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H405DEDE0D90F442CA9963846F464A218" qb-display-quote="yes"> (3) Cost A comprehensive breakdown of the full costs of the Program, including— <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HDD9871D21E804E1AAC2851E9EEC06670" qb-display-quote="yes"> (A) initial capital expenditure for system implementation; <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HC14A65C43067400D84CDAE99014255F4" qb-display-quote="yes"> (B) the cost of networking all installations and facilities across the Department of the Army within the United States; <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HDF17CCF2C44F4BF2AD39795B9DFA5F8B" qb-display-quote="yes"> (C) estimated operation and maintenance costs; <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H30ECE32CD2A24C31A0306579E9D71434" qb-display-quote="yes"> (D) a detailed funding schedule with expenditures projected across the period covered by the most recent future-years defense program submitted to Congress under section 221 of title 10, United States Code (as of the date of the plan); and <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H535267D15CF044BD87210DE59534BC71" qb-display-quote="yes"> (E) identification of potential cost-saving opportunities from the consolidation of current security monitoring systems. <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H68C3F91F13F043EDBAA368EDFFD05371" qb-display-quote="yes"> (4) Analysis of Viability An assessment of the viability of funding and sustaining the Program across the period covered by the most recent future-years defense program submitted to Congress under section 221 of title 10, United States Code (as of the date of the plan), considering— <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H08D0E3A910AB48A7890FEA065AAFFD01" qb-display-quote="yes"> (A) the financial impact relative to existing Army security infrastructure budgets; <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H3FF7ECB1903F4919B1C654A626D0DE2E" qb-display-quote="yes"> (B) cost-benefit analysis of upgrading existing systems versus implementing new technologies at each selected location; and <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H669545EED5504CB6B697FA763B78097F" qb-display-quote="yes"> (C) identification of technological challenges or barriers to implementing modern monitoring solutions.

<subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HA98C23D56EEE48638A06ECEFC5E3E4C6" qb-display-quote="yes"> (b) Designation The pilot program under subsection (a) shall be known as the <quote quote-display-end="auto" quote-display-start="auto" quote-type="text">Lethality and Warfighting Enhancement Program. <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HB846E47636224395BBE5A40568340C8F" qb-display-quote="yes"> (c) Locations The Secretary of the Army shall select not fewer than three military installations at which to conduct the pilot program under subsection (a). <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H9DA4C55250214F9C962F055F802787ED" qb-display-quote="yes"> (d) Objectives The objectives of the pilot program under subsection (a) shall be— <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H19DAAE05D48E4B379DC1ADD82575ECC5" qb-display-quote="yes"> (1) to increase the lethality of the combined fighting force of the Army by providing reserve component and National Guard infantry units with the opportunity to conduct realistic live fire training on state-of-the-art moving robotic target systems; and <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H972E24C05F794006A7A3161C10520411" qb-display-quote="yes"> (2) to demonstrate the effect of such training on small arms proficiency and lethality in ground combat operations.

<subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H9DA4C55250214F9C962F055F802787ED" qb-display-quote="yes"> (d) Objectives The objectives of the pilot program under subsection (a) shall be— <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H19DAAE05D48E4B379DC1ADD82575ECC5" qb-display-quote="yes"> (1) to increase the lethality of the combined fighting force of the Army by providing reserve component and National Guard infantry units with the opportunity to conduct realistic live fire training on state-of-the-art moving robotic target systems; and <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H972E24C05F794006A7A3161C10520411" qb-display-quote="yes"> (2) to demonstrate the effect of such training on small arms proficiency and lethality in ground combat operations. <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H75420C0FFC3D4A99ACF34FB032B801FF" qb-display-quote="yes"> (e) Selection of participating units The Secretary of the Army shall select infantry units of the reserve components of the Army to participate in the pilot program under subsection (a) taking into consideration— <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H12B8836C3FC144FD9F3FEA39DDE2DF6F" qb-display-quote="yes"> (1) the past performance of the unit; <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H5116B9F4334047F0A0C8888B6BED8DFE" qb-display-quote="yes"> (2) the readiness status of the unit, with an emphasis on providing training to those units designated as preparing to deploy or at a similarly designated readiness status; and <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H3ED5E8E858D14217AF97041B47C98944" qb-display-quote="yes"> (3) the likelihood that a unit would be actively deployed or commanded to conduct decisive action. <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H97D0E2B3DC444353852EC41883AF3C9D" qb-display-quote="yes"> (f) Commencement The Secretary of the Army shall commence the pilot program under subsection (a) not later than 180 days after the date of the enactment of this Act.

<subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H75420C0FFC3D4A99ACF34FB032B801FF" qb-display-quote="yes"> (e) Selection of participating units The Secretary of the Army shall select infantry units of the reserve components of the Army to participate in the pilot program under subsection (a) taking into consideration— <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H12B8836C3FC144FD9F3FEA39DDE2DF6F" qb-display-quote="yes"> (1) the past performance of the unit; <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H5116B9F4334047F0A0C8888B6BED8DFE" qb-display-quote="yes"> (2) the readiness status of the unit, with an emphasis on providing training to those units designated as preparing to deploy or at a similarly designated readiness status; and <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H3ED5E8E858D14217AF97041B47C98944" qb-display-quote="yes"> (3) the likelihood that a unit would be actively deployed or commanded to conduct decisive action. <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H97D0E2B3DC444353852EC41883AF3C9D" qb-display-quote="yes"> (f) Commencement The Secretary of the Army shall commence the pilot program under subsection (a) not later than 180 days after the date of the enactment of this Act. <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H9956A941E914466184A5756432265D82" qb-display-quote="yes"> (g) Termination The pilot program under subsection (a) shall terminate five years after the date of the enactment of this Act.

EXTENSION OF PROHIBITION ON AVAILABILITY OF FUNDS FOR NAVY PORT WATERBORNE SECURITY BARRIERS Section 130(a) of the John S. McCain National Defense Authorization Act for Fiscal Year 2019 (Public Law 115–232; 132 Stat.

<section display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HFAAF93CF9CE2431D99BF7AF6630A9583" qb-display-quote="yes" section-type="subsequent-section"> 125. DESIGNATION OF OFFICIAL RESPONSIBLE FOR AUTONOMOUS SURFACE AND UNDERWATER DUAL-MODALITY VEHICLES <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H9425E3124958498DA6CE7251554BC5F4" qb-display-quote="yes"> (a) Designation required Not later than 180 days after the date of the enactment of this Act, the Secretary of the Navy shall designate an appropriate official within the Department of the Navy to have primary responsibility for the development and acquisition of surface and underwater dual-modality, advanced autonomous vehicles, consistent with warfighter requirements. <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H97AC07A779F947BCBCB61CF140A16451" qb-display-quote="yes"> (b) Program element The Secretary of the Navy shall ensure, within budget program elements for the Navy, that there is a dedicated program element for the development and acquisition of surface and underwater dual-modality, advanced autonomous vehicles.

<subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H182FC5B6699E43F7915866F4709CFCB9" qb-display-quote="yes"> (b) Plan required Not later than April 15, 2025, the Secretary of the Navy shall submit to the congressional defense committees a plan for the potential establishment of a deployable tactical fighter squadron capability in the Naval Reserve using the covered F–18 aircraft. The plan shall include— <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H056AB95E66C04DA3B471A0954D7AA63B" qb-display-quote="yes"> (1) a description of any funding and other resources needed to establish and maintain such capability; and <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HA920AB36DD954E65A77D785834111EC4" qb-display-quote="yes"> (2) a proposed timeline for the implementation of such capability. <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H0FC9132662A64D199F9AD80FC247B619" qb-display-quote="yes"> (c) Covered F–18 aircraft defined In this section, the term <quote quote-display-end="auto" quote-display-start="auto" quote-type="text">covered F–18 aircraft means the eight F/A–18E/F Super Hornet aircraft procured using funds authorized and appropriated for the Navy during fiscal year 2023.

ANNUAL REPORT ON AIR FORCE TACTICAL FIGHTER AIRCRAFT FORCE STRUCTURE Chapter 907 of title 10, United States Code, is amended by inserting after section 9062 the following new section: <quoted-block display-end-quotes="yes" display-inline="no-display-inline" display-quotes="yes" id="H4B37A5A4A7AE4D39A49537E136644DB0" style="OLC"> <section display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H72F56F8E1D044797B609400E29454CBE" qb-display-quote="yes" section-type="subsequent-section"> 9062a. ANNUAL REPORT ON AIR FORCE TACTICAL FIGHTER AIRCRAFT FORCE STRUCTURE. <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HD930DBE5A09D44EC9CABA44455C70660" qb-display-quote="yes"> (a) In general Not later than April 1, 2025, and annually thereafter through 2029, the Secretary of the Air Force, in consultation with the Director of the Air National Guard and the Commander of the Air Force Reserve Command, shall— <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H348BD966754C4EA2A83C1F3F40027CDD" qb-display-quote="yes"> (1) develop a 10-year tactical fighter aircraft force structure, recapitalization, training, and sustainment plan for the active and reserve components of the Air Force; and <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HA7F8D270018747A0B928519F98E92FE9" qb-display-quote="yes"> (2) submit to the congressional defense committees a report on the plan.

<subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HD930DBE5A09D44EC9CABA44455C70660" qb-display-quote="yes"> (a) In general Not later than April 1, 2025, and annually thereafter through 2029, the Secretary of the Air Force, in consultation with the Director of the Air National Guard and the Commander of the Air Force Reserve Command, shall— <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H348BD966754C4EA2A83C1F3F40027CDD" qb-display-quote="yes"> (1) develop a 10-year tactical fighter aircraft force structure, recapitalization, training, and sustainment plan for the active and reserve components of the Air Force; and <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HA7F8D270018747A0B928519F98E92FE9" qb-display-quote="yes"> (2) submit to the congressional defense committees a report on the plan. <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H04503E01254F4E5C813B2A002514EE8A" qb-display-quote="yes"> (b) Elements of report The report required by subsection (a) shall address each of the following: <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H015AB43C7643444880E1A9316C019C95" qb-display-quote="yes"> (1) The appropriate mix of tactical fighter aircraft, and associated operational risk analyses, required for the Secretary of the Air Force to meet expected steady-state, global force management allocation plans and geographic combatant commander contingency operational plans tasked to the Air Force, using active and reserve component tactical fighter aircraft units. <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H111314237EE4403FB039AF91561BA2E3" qb-display-quote="yes"> (2) The procurement, divestment, and unit activation, deactivation, or re-missioning plans or actions the Secretary plans to implement, fiscal year-by-fiscal year, unit-by-unit, for the 10-year period beginning on the date on which the report is submitted, for each active and reserve component tactical fighter aircraft unit existing as of such date of submittal, including the rationale and justification for any such plans or actions.

<subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HD930DBE5A09D44EC9CABA44455C70660" qb-display-quote="yes"> (a) In general Not later than April 1, 2025, and annually thereafter through 2029, the Secretary of the Air Force, in consultation with the Director of the Air National Guard and the Commander of the Air Force Reserve Command, shall— <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H348BD966754C4EA2A83C1F3F40027CDD" qb-display-quote="yes"> (1) develop a 10-year tactical fighter aircraft force structure, recapitalization, training, and sustainment plan for the active and reserve components of the Air Force; and <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HA7F8D270018747A0B928519F98E92FE9" qb-display-quote="yes"> (2) submit to the congressional defense committees a report on the plan. <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H04503E01254F4E5C813B2A002514EE8A" qb-display-quote="yes"> (b) Elements of report The report required by subsection (a) shall address each of the following: <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H015AB43C7643444880E1A9316C019C95" qb-display-quote="yes"> (1) The appropriate mix of tactical fighter aircraft, and associated operational risk analyses, required for the Secretary of the Air Force to meet expected steady-state, global force management allocation plans and geographic combatant commander contingency operational plans tasked to the Air Force, using active and reserve component tactical fighter aircraft units. <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H111314237EE4403FB039AF91561BA2E3" qb-display-quote="yes"> (2) The procurement, divestment, and unit activation, deactivation, or re-missioning plans or actions the Secretary plans to implement, fiscal year-by-fiscal year, unit-by-unit, for the 10-year period beginning on the date on which the report is submitted, for each active and reserve component tactical fighter aircraft unit existing as of such date of submittal, including the rationale and justification for any such plans or actions.

<paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H5096FA1C48A4490792101C98C4760B8A" qb-display-quote="yes"> (4) Any plans of the Secretary to augment or supplant existing piloted tactical fighter aircraft capability or capacity with collaborative combat aircraft increment 1 or increment 2 capability or capacity. <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H4245846AA48F4E618C9C7145B2334540" qb-display-quote="yes"> (5) Any plans of the Secretary to augment or supplant existing piloted tactical fighter aircraft training events through the acquisition and fielding of common, joint, all-domain, high-fidelity synthetic simulation environments. <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H3C839943E2BA4F50B324E7845DF793E3" qb-display-quote="yes"> (c) Form of report The report required by subsection (a) shall be submitted in unclassified form with accompanying graphs, tables, and charts, but may contain a classified annex.

and <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H3A1C588D7CFB41C09691008E33425B17" qb-display-quote="yes"> (2) by inserting after subsection (b) the following new subsection (c): <quoted-block display-end-quotes="yes" display-inline="no-display-inline" display-quotes="yes" id="H8D51C1FBC1C448F090297E2E696308A5" style="OLC"> <section display-inline="no-display-inline" id="d1e4701" qb-display-quote="yes" section-type="subsequent-section"> <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HE79EA103A66A4A8582FD59D896E3703E" qb-display-quote="yes"> (c) Temporary relocation The Secretary of the Air Force shall, to the extent practicable, manage the temporary relocation of any B–1 bomber aircraft or personnel assigned to units responsible for the operation and maintenance of such aircraft resulting from planned military construction in a manner that— <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H4BABF110BD1B49CA85CD413A48612956" qb-display-quote="yes"> (1) minimizes effects to combat readiness; <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HE4E0A434E26046089F7E29244D6E161E" qb-display-quote="yes"> (2) mitigates the risk of concentrating a significant number of the total B–1 bomber fleet at one location; <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HFE7CB156C79043158853FFC59082ECA7" qb-display-quote="yes"> (b) Implementation plan Not later than 120 days after the date of the enactment of this Act, the Secretary of the Air Force shall develop and initiate an implementation plan for the transfers required under subsection (a). <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HB95E7F79447F4C1E90E3291203A8EF58" qb-display-quote="yes"> (c) Report Not later than 30 days after completing the development of the implementation plan required under subsection (b), the Secretary of the Air Force shall submit to the Committees on Armed Services of the House of Representatives and the Senate a report that includes a description of— <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H959CEBD49555439CB088F8884A0DCD2F" qb-display-quote="yes"> (1) the planned milestones for execution of the implementation plan; <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H68B3F39535FE4636B604776DA6DAF1AB" qb-display-quote="yes"> (2) any data, staff, and funding needed to effectively carry out such plan; and <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H45FB5CBDA9BE41DAA5C376F750956DC8" qb-display-quote="yes"> (3) the progress of the Secretary in meeting such milestones as of the date of the report. <section display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H951539F4237F453199DA5A122DF566FC" qb-display-quote="yes" section-type="subsequent-section"> 148.

<subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HB95E7F79447F4C1E90E3291203A8EF58" qb-display-quote="yes"> (c) Report Not later than 30 days after completing the development of the implementation plan required under subsection (b), the Secretary of the Air Force shall submit to the Committees on Armed Services of the House of Representatives and the Senate a report that includes a description of— <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H959CEBD49555439CB088F8884A0DCD2F" qb-display-quote="yes"> (1) the planned milestones for execution of the implementation plan; <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H68B3F39535FE4636B604776DA6DAF1AB" qb-display-quote="yes"> (2) any data, staff, and funding needed to effectively carry out such plan; and <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H45FB5CBDA9BE41DAA5C376F750956DC8" qb-display-quote="yes"> (3) the progress of the Secretary in meeting such milestones as of the date of the report. <section display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H951539F4237F453199DA5A122DF566FC" qb-display-quote="yes" section-type="subsequent-section"> 148. RECAPITALIZATION OF AIR REFUELING TANKER AIRCRAFT OF THE RESERVE COMPONENTS OF THE AIR FORCE <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HC9F4578B65B0465A989BE1329CF05CBC" qb-display-quote="yes"> (a) In general The Secretary of the Air Force shall replace covered reserve KC–135 aircraft on a one-for-one basis with air refueling tanker aircraft that have capabilities equivalent to or exceeding the capabilities of the aircraft being replaced.

<subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H90B58F86DCBB4615AB231E676F3624B5" qb-display-quote="yes"> (b) Additional requirements In carrying out subsection (a), the Secretary of the Air Force— <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H578B01BBE59C4403AC8E8BC529182D35" qb-display-quote="yes"> (1) may not take any action that would reduce the inventory of air refueling tanker aircraft assigned to a reserve component below the levels set forth in the budget of the President for fiscal year 2025 (as submitted to Congress under section 1105(a) of title 31, United States Code); and <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HED7DE57B47C84351B09F7D5DBFB54B80" qb-display-quote="yes"> (2) shall ensure that, in the event a reserve component unit is assigned a greater number of KC–135 aircraft than are being replaced with a KC–46 or later-generation air refueling tanker aircraft, any KC–135 aircraft remaining after such replacement will remain within the reserve component for redistribution within that component. <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HF84EF12943774985A831D3CD6D8ECB36" qb-display-quote="yes"> (c) Waiver The Secretary of the Air Force may waive the requirement to replace an air refueling tanker aircraft under subsection (a), on a case by case basis, if the Secretary determines that such replacement would degrade the readiness of the air refueling capability of the Air Force. <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H57652C4A10B4472E8110CFA5792D962C" qb-display-quote="yes"> (d) Sunset This section shall terminate on October 1, 2025.

<subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H045579E3F2CF4CD8A34D1FA74E68FFA9" qb-display-quote="yes"> (e) Covered reserve KC–135 aircraft defined In this section, the term <quote quote-display-end="auto" quote-display-start="auto" quote-type="text">covered reserve KC–135 aircraft means a KC–135 aircraft of the reserve components of the Air Force that the Secretary of the Air Force has identified to be replaced with a KC–46 or later-generation air refueling tanker aircraft. <section display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H0D7A804CCFE24AC4AA790FC1D116166E" qb-display-quote="yes" section-type="subsequent-section"> 149. PROHIBITION ON REDUCTION OF KC–135 AIRCRAFT IN PMAI OF THE RESERVE COMPONENTS <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HA1ED048F8E52401094BC7ED9C148B823" qb-display-quote="yes"> (a) In general None of the funds authorized to be appropriated by this Act or otherwise made available for fiscal year 2025 for the Air Force may be obligated or expended to reduce the number of KC–135 aircraft designated as primary mission aircraft inventory within the reserve components of the Air Force.

<section display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H64D2E287F80E40AAA6C3BF3E3DDED834" qb-display-quote="yes" section-type="subsequent-section"> 150. PROHIBITION ON RETIREMENT OF F–15E AIRCRAFT AND REQUIREMENT TO CONDUCT FIGHTER AIRCRAFT CAPABILITIES AND REQUIREMENTS STUDY <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HEAE87FEEF5ED41C5A84DD565E6B51E63" qb-display-quote="yes"> (a) Prohibition on retirement of F–15E aircraft <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H32EC210A99DC4D98AABFF5637545F6D4" qb-display-quote="yes"> (1) In general The Secretary of the Air Force may not retire, prepare to retire, or place in storage or on backup aircraft inventory status any F–15E aircraft until September 30, 2027. <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H46B43C0925F54B77B3F81F605CAAC4EC" qb-display-quote="yes"> (2) Exception The prohibition under paragraph (1) of shall not apply to individual F–15E aircraft that the Secretary of the Air Force determines, on a case by case basis, to be no longer mission capable and uneconomical to repair because of aircraft accidents, mishaps, or excessive material degradation and non-airworthiness status of certain aircraft.

<paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HE9A0A61C222745B4AEE50B668ADEEC2C" qb-display-quote="yes"> (3) Relationship to other law The prohibition under paragraph (1) supercedes any provision of section 9062(l) of title 10, United States Code, that is inconsistent with such prohibition. <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HDCC653A1BB94419FA93CEA6D09EFF786" qb-display-quote="yes"> (b) Fighter aircraft capabilities and requirements study <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H097D63A2404C47D1A0550DE16DDE8B11" qb-display-quote="yes"> (1) Study The Secretary of Defense shall seek to enter into a contract or other agreement with a federally funded research and development center pursuant to which the center shall carry out— <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H8940A8C963B2466EBDB8E8BDC5099D06" qb-display-quote="yes"> (A) an analysis of the fighter aircraft procurement, fielding, and divestment plan of the Department of the Air Force, as submitted to Congress in accordance with section 148 of the National Defense Authorization Act for Fiscal Year 2024 (Public Law 118–31; 137 Stat. 178); and <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H66AA9F3D29B64051AF08DD58B3C4B2E2" qb-display-quote="yes"> (B) a fighter aircraft capability and requirements study that estimates the number of fighter aircraft needed by the Air Force to meet the requirements of combatant commanders.

<subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HDCC653A1BB94419FA93CEA6D09EFF786" qb-display-quote="yes"> (b) Fighter aircraft capabilities and requirements study <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H097D63A2404C47D1A0550DE16DDE8B11" qb-display-quote="yes"> (1) Study The Secretary of Defense shall seek to enter into a contract or other agreement with a federally funded research and development center pursuant to which the center shall carry out— <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H8940A8C963B2466EBDB8E8BDC5099D06" qb-display-quote="yes"> (A) an analysis of the fighter aircraft procurement, fielding, and divestment plan of the Department of the Air Force, as submitted to Congress in accordance with section 148 of the National Defense Authorization Act for Fiscal Year 2024 (Public Law 118–31; 137 Stat. 178); and <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H66AA9F3D29B64051AF08DD58B3C4B2E2" qb-display-quote="yes"> (B) a fighter aircraft capability and requirements study that estimates the number of fighter aircraft needed by the Air Force to meet the requirements of combatant commanders. <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H07DC7E5FA22E4348A7DBE3422C36F998" qb-display-quote="yes"> (2) Report to secretary The federally funded research and development center that carries out the study and analysis under paragraph (1) shall submit to the Secretary of Defense a report on the results of such study and analysis.

<paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H07DC7E5FA22E4348A7DBE3422C36F998" qb-display-quote="yes"> (2) Report to secretary The federally funded research and development center that carries out the study and analysis under paragraph (1) shall submit to the Secretary of Defense a report on the results of such study and analysis. <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H8DCE4B48A99749019EC2165414C42D2E" qb-display-quote="yes"> (3) Reports and briefing to congress Not later than March 15, 2026, the Secretary of Defense shall— <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HA773038208B34EBC91AFC7AAF6567C4C" qb-display-quote="yes"> (A) submit to the congressional defense committees an unaltered copy of the report received by the Secretary under paragraph (2); <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H9B81162C6D7E49AFBD7DFC8156A71624" qb-display-quote="yes"> (B) submit to such committees a separate report on the views of the Secretary with respect to the results of the study and analysis carried out under paragraph (1), which shall include— <clause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H4C11993E128042A9B34FE8B76F07A6A3" qb-display-quote="yes"> (i) a detailed explanation of the strategy and methodology used to conduct the study and analysis, including any force sizing and shaping constructs, scenarios, and assumptions used as part of such study and analysis; and <clause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HF2BAD689C33241A9A5BC0FBA340055DA" qb-display-quote="yes"> (ii) assessed operational risk based on the Chairman of the Joint Chiefs of Staff risk management classifications set forth the most recent version of the Chairman of the Joint Chiefs of Staff Manual 3105.01A, titled <quote quote-display-end="auto" quote-display-start="auto" quote-type="text">Joint Risk Analysis Methodology; and <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H79B56357760F4A21A83EA4E09068DE2C" qb-display-quote="yes"> (C) provide a briefing to the committees on such results. <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HCDEEEE48B7BB4F72B890ECF82D8CC89D" qb-display-quote="yes"> (c) Definitions In this section, the term <quote quote-display-end="auto" quote-display-start="auto" quote-type="text">fighter aircraft means— <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H7BE7AFB667824798913619DCBEF40FDF" qb-display-quote="yes"> (1) F–15, F–16, F–22, and F–35 aircraft; and <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HFD35A7C00F6A4DD1A85774EB50810439" qb-display-quote="yes"> (2) the Next Generation Air Dominance piloted combat aircraft.

<paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H07DC7E5FA22E4348A7DBE3422C36F998" qb-display-quote="yes"> (2) Report to secretary The federally funded research and development center that carries out the study and analysis under paragraph (1) shall submit to the Secretary of Defense a report on the results of such study and analysis. <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H8DCE4B48A99749019EC2165414C42D2E" qb-display-quote="yes"> (3) Reports and briefing to congress Not later than March 15, 2026, the Secretary of Defense shall— <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HA773038208B34EBC91AFC7AAF6567C4C" qb-display-quote="yes"> (A) submit to the congressional defense committees an unaltered copy of the report received by the Secretary under paragraph (2); <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H9B81162C6D7E49AFBD7DFC8156A71624" qb-display-quote="yes"> (B) submit to such committees a separate report on the views of the Secretary with respect to the results of the study and analysis carried out under paragraph (1), which shall include— <clause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H4C11993E128042A9B34FE8B76F07A6A3" qb-display-quote="yes"> (i) a detailed explanation of the strategy and methodology used to conduct the study and analysis, including any force sizing and shaping constructs, scenarios, and assumptions used as part of such study and analysis; and <clause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HF2BAD689C33241A9A5BC0FBA340055DA" qb-display-quote="yes"> (ii) assessed operational risk based on the Chairman of the Joint Chiefs of Staff risk management classifications set forth the most recent version of the Chairman of the Joint Chiefs of Staff Manual 3105.01A, titled <quote quote-display-end="auto" quote-display-start="auto" quote-type="text">Joint Risk Analysis Methodology; and <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H79B56357760F4A21A83EA4E09068DE2C" qb-display-quote="yes"> (C) provide a briefing to the committees on such results. <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HCDEEEE48B7BB4F72B890ECF82D8CC89D" qb-display-quote="yes"> (c) Definitions In this section, the term <quote quote-display-end="auto" quote-display-start="auto" quote-type="text">fighter aircraft means— <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H7BE7AFB667824798913619DCBEF40FDF" qb-display-quote="yes"> (1) F–15, F–16, F–22, and F–35 aircraft; and <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HFD35A7C00F6A4DD1A85774EB50810439" qb-display-quote="yes"> (2) the Next Generation Air Dominance piloted combat aircraft.

<paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H8DCE4B48A99749019EC2165414C42D2E" qb-display-quote="yes"> (3) Reports and briefing to congress Not later than March 15, 2026, the Secretary of Defense shall— <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HA773038208B34EBC91AFC7AAF6567C4C" qb-display-quote="yes"> (A) submit to the congressional defense committees an unaltered copy of the report received by the Secretary under paragraph (2); <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H9B81162C6D7E49AFBD7DFC8156A71624" qb-display-quote="yes"> (B) submit to such committees a separate report on the views of the Secretary with respect to the results of the study and analysis carried out under paragraph (1), which shall include— <clause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H4C11993E128042A9B34FE8B76F07A6A3" qb-display-quote="yes"> (i) a detailed explanation of the strategy and methodology used to conduct the study and analysis, including any force sizing and shaping constructs, scenarios, and assumptions used as part of such study and analysis; and <clause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HF2BAD689C33241A9A5BC0FBA340055DA" qb-display-quote="yes"> (ii) assessed operational risk based on the Chairman of the Joint Chiefs of Staff risk management classifications set forth the most recent version of the Chairman of the Joint Chiefs of Staff Manual 3105.01A, titled <quote quote-display-end="auto" quote-display-start="auto" quote-type="text">Joint Risk Analysis Methodology; and <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H79B56357760F4A21A83EA4E09068DE2C" qb-display-quote="yes"> (C) provide a briefing to the committees on such results. <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HCDEEEE48B7BB4F72B890ECF82D8CC89D" qb-display-quote="yes"> (c) Definitions In this section, the term <quote quote-display-end="auto" quote-display-start="auto" quote-type="text">fighter aircraft means— <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H7BE7AFB667824798913619DCBEF40FDF" qb-display-quote="yes"> (1) F–15, F–16, F–22, and F–35 aircraft; and <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HFD35A7C00F6A4DD1A85774EB50810439" qb-display-quote="yes"> (2) the Next Generation Air Dominance piloted combat aircraft. <section display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H701BBCF58B0C45B8B0D248FC8479DBDF" qb-display-quote="yes" section-type="subsequent-section"> 151.

<paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H8DCE4B48A99749019EC2165414C42D2E" qb-display-quote="yes"> (3) Reports and briefing to congress Not later than March 15, 2026, the Secretary of Defense shall— <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HA773038208B34EBC91AFC7AAF6567C4C" qb-display-quote="yes"> (A) submit to the congressional defense committees an unaltered copy of the report received by the Secretary under paragraph (2); <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H9B81162C6D7E49AFBD7DFC8156A71624" qb-display-quote="yes"> (B) submit to such committees a separate report on the views of the Secretary with respect to the results of the study and analysis carried out under paragraph (1), which shall include— <clause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H4C11993E128042A9B34FE8B76F07A6A3" qb-display-quote="yes"> (i) a detailed explanation of the strategy and methodology used to conduct the study and analysis, including any force sizing and shaping constructs, scenarios, and assumptions used as part of such study and analysis; and <clause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HF2BAD689C33241A9A5BC0FBA340055DA" qb-display-quote="yes"> (ii) assessed operational risk based on the Chairman of the Joint Chiefs of Staff risk management classifications set forth the most recent version of the Chairman of the Joint Chiefs of Staff Manual 3105.01A, titled <quote quote-display-end="auto" quote-display-start="auto" quote-type="text">Joint Risk Analysis Methodology; and <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H79B56357760F4A21A83EA4E09068DE2C" qb-display-quote="yes"> (C) provide a briefing to the committees on such results. <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HCDEEEE48B7BB4F72B890ECF82D8CC89D" qb-display-quote="yes"> (c) Definitions In this section, the term <quote quote-display-end="auto" quote-display-start="auto" quote-type="text">fighter aircraft means— <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H7BE7AFB667824798913619DCBEF40FDF" qb-display-quote="yes"> (1) F–15, F–16, F–22, and F–35 aircraft; and <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HFD35A7C00F6A4DD1A85774EB50810439" qb-display-quote="yes"> (2) the Next Generation Air Dominance piloted combat aircraft. <section display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H701BBCF58B0C45B8B0D248FC8479DBDF" qb-display-quote="yes" section-type="subsequent-section"> 151.

<section display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H701BBCF58B0C45B8B0D248FC8479DBDF" qb-display-quote="yes" section-type="subsequent-section"> 151. NOTIFICATION OF DELAYS IN DELIVERY OF MH–139 AIRCRAFT <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H7BC5C92910D946DBB96F7EBDB54EBA81" qb-display-quote="yes"> (a) Notice required Not later than 30 days after becoming aware of an expected delay in the delivery date of an MH–139 aircraft, the Secretary of the Air Force shall submit to the Committees on Armed Services of the Senate and the House of Representatives written notice of such delay together with an explanation of the reasons for such delay. <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H9FDA2DE3637A45CCB64C5C844EDCE400" qb-display-quote="yes"> (b) Delivery date defined In this section, the term <quote quote-display-end="auto" quote-display-start="auto" quote-type="text">delivery date, when used with respect to an MH–139 aircraft, means the date on which such aircraft is expected to be delivered to the Air Force under the most recent schedule for such delivery in effect as of the date of the enactment of this Act.

<section display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HF6C1E20C8FC24B6F9EC7FBC2A2C41663" qb-display-quote="yes" section-type="subsequent-section"> 152. PLAN AND REQUIREMENTS FOR FIELDING AIR BASE AIR DEFENSE SITES AT AIR FORCE INSTALLATIONS <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HB048033864DA4AECAFBCA5A586BFFD38" qb-display-quote="yes"> (a) Plan required The Secretary of the Air Force, in consultation with the Commander of the United States Northern Command, the Commander of United States European Command, and the Commander of United States Indo-Pacific Command, shall develop and implement a plan to support the fielding of air base air defense sites at Air Force installations and other priority sites identified by the Secretary. <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HF36ADA59B28240AFA59C16E59F078074" qb-display-quote="yes"> (b) Air base air defense site requirements Each air base air defense site fielded under the plan required under subsection (a) shall have the following capabilities: <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H3E778168B26B4541A3120D7E78AD607A" qb-display-quote="yes"> (1) Expeditionary mobile protection for dispersed air bases.

<subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HF36ADA59B28240AFA59C16E59F078074" qb-display-quote="yes"> (b) Air base air defense site requirements Each air base air defense site fielded under the plan required under subsection (a) shall have the following capabilities: <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H3E778168B26B4541A3120D7E78AD607A" qb-display-quote="yes"> (1) Expeditionary mobile protection for dispersed air bases. <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H4558D055A0D74758B486107C512E2D19" qb-display-quote="yes"> (2) Fixed protection for primary air bases. <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H4F50F4A2435B474FA4676BCCD1E940AA" qb-display-quote="yes"> (3) Ground-based protection systems that incorporate kinetic and non-kinetic capabilities.

<paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HFBD6646E50144C46A2CF5799B759810B" qb-display-quote="yes"> (6) Counter-cruise missile capabilities. <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HBC6EDFE9A78141C3A7E74754F358AB27" qb-display-quote="yes"> (7) Interoperability with joint command and control networks. <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H5AAE7F8CC8CF4CD6B4AE2CC58F584145" qb-display-quote="yes"> (8) 360-degree active and passive sensors.

<subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H3A31A69644DF43FA96931F8B60122598" qb-display-quote="yes"> (c) Fielding requirement Pursuant to the plan developed under subsection (a), the Secretary shall— <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HE933AC091F474A7298A64ED53B91D30C" qb-display-quote="yes"> (1) by not later than September 30, 2027, field a total of not fewer than four air base air defense sites, of which not fewer than two such sites shall be located in the United States; and <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H856458F703314F9E9528B4988A6A0726" qb-display-quote="yes"> (2) in each of fiscal years 2028 through 2031, field at least four air base air defense sites per year, of which not fewer than two of the sites fielded each year shall be located in the United States. <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H7F567BE068104B878938C183B2D3CCCD" qb-display-quote="yes"> (d) Report Not later than March 1, 2025, the Secretary of the Air Force shall submit to the congressional defense committees a report on the plan required under subsection (a). <section display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H1D9AACA284A549C283CD5B4B343111A4" qb-display-quote="yes" section-type="subsequent-section"> 153.

CENTRALIZED SECURITY MONITORING PROGRAM FOR FACILITIES OF THE ARMY <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H5770747E693444F7B7D6F334D390EF7F" qb-display-quote="yes"> (a) In general The Secretary of the Army, in coordination with the heads of relevant organizations of the Department of Defense and other departments and agencies of the Federal Government, shall develop a plan for the implementation of a Centralized Security Monitoring Program (referred to in this section as the <quote quote-display-end="auto" quote-display-start="auto" quote-type="text">Program) for installations and facilities of the Department of the Army within the United States. <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H778C910944B443EB8A9C8126BD24BB4A" qb-display-quote="yes"> (b) Elements The plan required by subsection (a) shall include the following: <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H5CE78934C7554A28A9D2E6BC4892B249" qb-display-quote="yes"> (1) Proposed security solution A proposal for the development and implementation of a cost-effective, scalable solution to modernize and centralize security operations across Army facilities in the United States with full consideration given to minimizing operational impacts while maximizing technological advantages for enhanced security. <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H7AFFACCBB3254083B530698595567D17" qb-display-quote="yes"> (2) Locations Identification of at least three military installations selected to host the Program.

<subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H778C910944B443EB8A9C8126BD24BB4A" qb-display-quote="yes"> (b) Elements The plan required by subsection (a) shall include the following: <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H5CE78934C7554A28A9D2E6BC4892B249" qb-display-quote="yes"> (1) Proposed security solution A proposal for the development and implementation of a cost-effective, scalable solution to modernize and centralize security operations across Army facilities in the United States with full consideration given to minimizing operational impacts while maximizing technological advantages for enhanced security. <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H7AFFACCBB3254083B530698595567D17" qb-display-quote="yes"> (2) Locations Identification of at least three military installations selected to host the Program. These locations shall— <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H16A2440EEB6B49998CB7E93C7E2160C6" qb-display-quote="yes"> (A) serve as the primary hubs for the continuous monitoring of installation security across all installations of the Department of the Army in the United States; <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H4E26FAB0C5FA408A9ED3CB2B31B28452" qb-display-quote="yes"> (B) represent a mix of large and extra-large facilities, as defined by the 2016 business case analysis conducted by the Provost Marshal General of the Army; and <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HAF80BFC23FE6463D9D031A3CD38530A4" qb-display-quote="yes"> (C) be chosen based on geographical diversity and their strategic importance to the Army’s overall security infrastructure.

These locations shall— <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H16A2440EEB6B49998CB7E93C7E2160C6" qb-display-quote="yes"> (A) serve as the primary hubs for the continuous monitoring of installation security across all installations of the Department of the Army in the United States; <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H4E26FAB0C5FA408A9ED3CB2B31B28452" qb-display-quote="yes"> (B) represent a mix of large and extra-large facilities, as defined by the 2016 business case analysis conducted by the Provost Marshal General of the Army; and <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HAF80BFC23FE6463D9D031A3CD38530A4" qb-display-quote="yes"> (C) be chosen based on geographical diversity and their strategic importance to the Army’s overall security infrastructure. <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H405DEDE0D90F442CA9963846F464A218" qb-display-quote="yes"> (3) Cost A comprehensive breakdown of the full costs of the Program, including— <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HDD9871D21E804E1AAC2851E9EEC06670" qb-display-quote="yes"> (A) initial capital expenditure for system implementation; <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HC14A65C43067400D84CDAE99014255F4" qb-display-quote="yes"> (B) the cost of networking all installations and facilities across the Department of the Army within the United States; <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HDF17CCF2C44F4BF2AD39795B9DFA5F8B" qb-display-quote="yes"> (C) estimated operation and maintenance costs; <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H30ECE32CD2A24C31A0306579E9D71434" qb-display-quote="yes"> (D) a detailed funding schedule with expenditures projected across the period covered by the most recent future-years defense program submitted to Congress under section 221 of title 10, United States Code (as of the date of the plan); and <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H535267D15CF044BD87210DE59534BC71" qb-display-quote="yes"> (E) identification of potential cost-saving opportunities from the consolidation of current security monitoring systems. <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H68C3F91F13F043EDBAA368EDFFD05371" qb-display-quote="yes"> (4) Analysis of Viability An assessment of the viability of funding and sustaining the Program across the period covered by the most recent future-years defense program submitted to Congress under section 221 of title 10, United States Code (as of the date of the plan), considering— <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H08D0E3A910AB48A7890FEA065AAFFD01" qb-display-quote="yes"> (A) the financial impact relative to existing Army security infrastructure budgets; <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H3FF7ECB1903F4919B1C654A626D0DE2E" qb-display-quote="yes"> (B) cost-benefit analysis of upgrading existing systems versus implementing new technologies at each selected location; and <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H669545EED5504CB6B697FA763B78097F" qb-display-quote="yes"> (C) identification of technological challenges or barriers to implementing modern monitoring solutions.

<paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H6272B945C7B94974AEE2A2167F15BFA1" qb-display-quote="yes"> (5) Authorities A list of any additional authorities, appropriations, or other resources necessary to ensure the success of the Program. <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HAC1CA925F729480D91B64E4B73807695" qb-display-quote="yes"> (c) Submittal to Congress Not later than September 1, 2025, the Secretary of the Army shall submit to the Committees on Armed Services of the Senate and House of Representatives a completed version of the plan developed under subsection (a). <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HA0D5C7300F4D48E1A0E9519148A18CB5" qb-display-quote="yes"> (d) Limitation on commencement The Secretary of the Army may not commence implementation of the Program until the date on which the Secretary certifies to the congressional defense committees that sufficient appropriations for military construction and operational costs have been programmed to fund the Program.

<subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HA0D5C7300F4D48E1A0E9519148A18CB5" qb-display-quote="yes"> (d) Limitation on commencement The Secretary of the Army may not commence implementation of the Program until the date on which the Secretary certifies to the congressional defense committees that sufficient appropriations for military construction and operational costs have been programmed to fund the Program. <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H46353263DA8445468051BBEB9623E6A3" qb-display-quote="yes"> (e) Deadline for implementation <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HD50A4AFCBC0442EE9EBB56D6F64FAB72" qb-display-quote="yes"> (1) In general Except as provided in paragraph (2), the Secretary of the Army shall implement the Program by not later than January 1, 2027. <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HD394894247F5442A80C36BA7848F1772" qb-display-quote="yes"> (2) Alternative implementation date In the event the certification described in subsection (d) is not submitted on or before January 1, 2027, the Secretary of the Army shall implement the Program as soon as practicable after the date on which such certification is so submitted.

<subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H46353263DA8445468051BBEB9623E6A3" qb-display-quote="yes"> (e) Deadline for implementation <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HD50A4AFCBC0442EE9EBB56D6F64FAB72" qb-display-quote="yes"> (1) In general Except as provided in paragraph (2), the Secretary of the Army shall implement the Program by not later than January 1, 2027. <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HD394894247F5442A80C36BA7848F1772" qb-display-quote="yes"> (2) Alternative implementation date In the event the certification described in subsection (d) is not submitted on or before January 1, 2027, the Secretary of the Army shall implement the Program as soon as practicable after the date on which such certification is so submitted. <section display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HFC4A3A4DFEA54E6BA2749262501840E4" qb-display-quote="yes" section-type="subsequent-section"> 112.

PILOT PROGRAM ON THE USE OF ROBOTIC TARGETS TO ENHANCE THE LETHALITY OF THE RESERVE COMPONENTS OF THE ARMY <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H9679906CE7644BE090849B6FFEBA7976" qb-display-quote="yes"> (a) Establishment The Secretary of the Army shall carry out a pilot program under which the Secretary incorporates the use of moving robotic target systems into live fire training provided to select infantry units of the reserve and National Guard components of the Army. <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HA98C23D56EEE48638A06ECEFC5E3E4C6" qb-display-quote="yes"> (b) Designation The pilot program under subsection (a) shall be known as the <quote quote-display-end="auto" quote-display-start="auto" quote-type="text">Lethality and Warfighting Enhancement Program. <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HB846E47636224395BBE5A40568340C8F" qb-display-quote="yes"> (c) Locations The Secretary of the Army shall select not fewer than three military installations at which to conduct the pilot program under subsection (a).

<subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HB846E47636224395BBE5A40568340C8F" qb-display-quote="yes"> (c) Locations The Secretary of the Army shall select not fewer than three military installations at which to conduct the pilot program under subsection (a). <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H9DA4C55250214F9C962F055F802787ED" qb-display-quote="yes"> (d) Objectives The objectives of the pilot program under subsection (a) shall be— <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H19DAAE05D48E4B379DC1ADD82575ECC5" qb-display-quote="yes"> (1) to increase the lethality of the combined fighting force of the Army by providing reserve component and National Guard infantry units with the opportunity to conduct realistic live fire training on state-of-the-art moving robotic target systems; and <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H972E24C05F794006A7A3161C10520411" qb-display-quote="yes"> (2) to demonstrate the effect of such training on small arms proficiency and lethality in ground combat operations. <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H75420C0FFC3D4A99ACF34FB032B801FF" qb-display-quote="yes"> (e) Selection of participating units The Secretary of the Army shall select infantry units of the reserve components of the Army to participate in the pilot program under subsection (a) taking into consideration— <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H12B8836C3FC144FD9F3FEA39DDE2DF6F" qb-display-quote="yes"> (1) the past performance of the unit; <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H5116B9F4334047F0A0C8888B6BED8DFE" qb-display-quote="yes"> (2) the readiness status of the unit, with an emphasis on providing training to those units designated as preparing to deploy or at a similarly designated readiness status; and <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H3ED5E8E858D14217AF97041B47C98944" qb-display-quote="yes"> (3) the likelihood that a unit would be actively deployed or commanded to conduct decisive action.
